jobDescription: Datadog is seeking a full-time Accounts Payable (AP) Analyst to become an essential part of a company’s rapidly growing team. Reporting to the Accounts Payable Lead, this individual will be responsible for processing domestic and international vendor invoices and payments and working with our procurement team to develop purchasing best practices. This role will own the Accounts Payable processes for our business ensuring that invoices are processed and paid according to AP policies/controls and that any problems or questions relating to accounts payable are resolved or answered efficiently. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Process, code, and ensure accuracy and completeness of invoices in a timely manner in Coupa Review GL coding of invoices to ensure expenses are coded in accordance with GAAP Assist with 1099 reporting and maintenance of W-9 forms Work closely with vendors/suppliers and internal departments to resolve any payment issues Reconcile and/or analyze vendor accounts/statements Approve new vendor profiles as needed in Coupa and verify banking information submitted in Coupa for new vendors Review employee expense reports ensuring they adhere to the company expense policy Who You Are: Experienced in a minimum of 2 years in accounts payable work and hold a Bachelor’s degree Someone with a high degree of accuracy, attention to detail and confidentiality Strongly proficient in Microsoft Excel Data-driven and analytical with strong problem-solving and decision-making skills Someone who demonstrates a sense of urgency and ability to meet deadlines Familiar with Coupa, Netsuite, and Expensify is a plus Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSU) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, opportunity to join our Community Guilds Generous and competitive global and US benefits Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $65,000 - $85,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. About Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. The Team: As a function of Datadog’s Go-to-Market (GTM) Enablement department, the Business Value team is a unique strategy, operations and analytics team at Datadog. Our GTM Enablement org works with a best-in-class product that solves real problems for our customers, and our Business Value team partners with go-to-market teams and customers to drive revenue and high-level strategic decision making across the entire business. The Opportunity: We’re seeking a creative and entrepreneurial Business Value Manager located in Mid-West, Rockies and Texas region who will partner directly with our customers to build business cases that quantify the business value our products deliver to their bottom line. This critical customer-facing position will collaborate cross-functionally with teams ranging from Sales and Post Sales to Marketing and Product in order to scale the business value function within Datadog. In this role you will directly impact the bottom line of our business while gaining executive visibility inside and outside of the organization. You Will: Work closely with customers to identify key business drivers and conduct business value assessments for our largest deals Develop in-depth ROI/TCO value models to quantify business value that can be achieved through our products Partner with sellers to lead value-based discovery sessions with technical and business stakeholders to drive key objectives and measurable outcomes Craft and deliver executive level presentations to CxOs Perform strategic analyses in support of sales opportunities Develop models, processes, and materials to drive continuous improvement in our Business Value Program Become an expert in Datadog selling methodology while driving adoption Assist with Datadog’s ongoing field enablement efforts with value selling training, designing new training curriculum, knowledge management, etc Build external presence via delivery of webinars and other events to communicate Datadog’s value to our customers in achieving key digital transformation initiatives You Are: Experienced in 6+ years working in a related field with 4+ years experience in: running business value assessments; management consulting or IT consulting with proven track record of advising senior business stakeholders; enterprise sales or other equivalent experience Someone who holds a BA in Computer Science, Engineering, Economics, Finance, or other analytical field required, MBA or other advanced degree strongly preferred Outstanding in your analytical abilities, verbal and written communication skills An exceptionally strong presenter with demonstrated experience in client-facing role or working with C-suite executives Someone who brings a strategic, consultative mindset Confident in building financial models and analyzing businesses Passionate about coaching other and comfortable working and leading cross-functional teams Willing to travel up to 20% of time Bonus Points: Highly analytical and comfortable with complex data sets Creative problem solver who thrives with ambiguity Equally comfortable with the big picture and with the details Experience in a SaaS company in a complex sales-cycle. Knowledge and interest in the cloud and monitoring space. Excited to work with engineering, marketing, sales, finance and other functions Why You Should Apply: Generous and competitive US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture This is a remote position The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $113,000 - $165,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Cloud Ops Financial Analyst - Cost Reporting Team
jobDescription: The Cost Reporting team is responsible for identifying and executing on cost-saving opportunities, providing engineering teams meaningful visibility into spend, and empowering finance to understand and incorporate the complexities of cloud costs. The team manages the spend for a complex, multi-cloud, large scale cloud infrastructure. We are looking for the right people to help us scale this team’s capabilities to match our exponential growth. You'll be creating new ways to manage a substantial cloud spend, visualize cloud cost insights, and improve cost efficiency. What You’ll Do: Partner with finance and engineering teams to ensure cross-department alignment; forecast spending and model our growth against engineering roadmaps. Report on results against our cloud projections to company leadership. Work across engineering departments to evangelize savings opportunities and evaluate the cost effectiveness of new engineering initiatives. Create new ways to identify and visualize key cloud cost insights, creating tools and processes to improve cloud usage efficiency. Who You Are: Demonstrated experience with SQL, BI tools like Metabase, Looker, Mode, Metabase, and spreadsheet wizardry to build cost models and discover meaningful insights. You have demonstrated experience providing a digestible financial view of a complex problem space; and it’s the kind of problem you’re excited to tackle. You have been analyzing and forecasting public spend at a large scale. You have excellent communication skills and demonstrated experience in partnering with clients. Bonus: Experience with billing, product offerings, reservation discounts management with one or more of AWS/GCP/Azure. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. This is a remote position The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $77,000 - $112,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. Report on results against our cloud projections to company leadership. Work across engineering departments to evangelize savings opportunities and evaluate the cost effectiveness of new engineering initiatives. Create new ways to identify and visualize key cloud cost insights, creating tools and processes to improve cloud usage efficiency. Who You Are: Demonstrated experience with SQL, BI tools like Metabase, Looker, Mode, Metabase, and spreadsheet wizardry to build cost models and discover meaningful insights. You have demonstrated experience providing a digestible financial view of a complex problem space; and it’s the kind of problem you’re excited to tackle. You have been analyzing and forecasting public spend at a large scale. You have excellent communication skills and demonstrated experience in partnering with clients. Bonus: Experience with billing, product offerings, reservation discounts management with one or more of AWS/GCP/Azure. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. This is a remote position The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $77,000 - $112,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. Join our global Sales and Alliances Legal team to partner with sales and other internal stakeholders to act as a trusted advisor, with a primary focus on supporting the sales organization in negotiating revenue generating deals for Datadog customers in western North America. The Legal team supports Datadog's rapid growth by providing a wide range of legal services across a highly dynamic technology company, from driving new business via contracts and compliance efforts, to protecting Datadog's intellectual property. This role will be based out of our offices in either San Francisco, Denver, or New York. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Review and negotiate customer and partner subscription agreements and ancillary documents such as DPAs. Partner with a seasoned legal team to provide practical and decisive guidance to internal teams. Train sales team members on strategies for negotiating with customers. Support the ongoing improvement of our contract templates, playbooks and processes. Collaborate with other teams within Legal and across the company to support Datadog’s acceleration of revenue generation and reduction of risk, including product legal, support, deal desk, and privacy. Who You Are: A natural-born negotiator, communicator, and educator with a minimum of 3 years of legal experience with commercial contracts. Looking for an opportunity to partner with and learn from seasoned legal professionals as we continue to support Datadog’s rapid growth. Someone with integrity, excellent judgment, and a high degree of emotional intelligence; you are prepared to build strong collaboration channels with peers and stakeholders across the business and ready to identify pathways to success with our customers. Comfortable working independently, adhering to established process, and able to recognize when you need guidance. Excited to drive contracts to closure and comfortable partnering with clients in sales, where you will work on multiple deals at the same time while meeting tight deadlines. Familiar with SaaS and related technology areas, including privacy and intellectual property. Licensed to practice law and have earned a JD and bar admission in the U.S. Someone in a western U.S. timezone or able to support clients during Pacific Time business hours. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive benefits package New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Employee-focused best in class onboarding Internal mentor and cross-departmental buddy program Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $171,000 - $251,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The Team: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. Technical solutions is a growing global team that collaborates constantly to share knowledge and continuously advance our technical skillset. The Opportunity: Sales Engineers help qualify and close opportunities with customers and partners. You will provide technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, and supporting technical evaluations (POCs). SEs also have a voice with the product team to help prioritize features based on input from customers, competitors, and partners. Additionally, you will work with various teams to resolve customer concerns, escalate bug issues, and serve as an ambassador for our brand. If you want to join a friendly, passionate team with limitless potential, we’d love to meet you! You Will: Partner with the sales team to articulate the overall Datadog value proposition, vision and strategy to customers Continually learn new technology to build competitive knowledge, technical skill, and credibility Deliver product and technical presentations with potential clients Have a direct line of communication with the product team to collaborate on feature requests Help clients onboard the product and assist when they run into roadblocks. Think creatively about a wide variety of technical challenges during the presales life cycle You Are: Knowledgeable and experienced with DevOps monitoring or architecture tools. Comfortable and confident in delivering technical presentations/demos to either external customers or internal teams Able to think creatively about a wide variety of challenges. You're going to find new things every day. Experienced in systems administrations: Windows or Linux Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 25% of the time Bonus Points: Experience in container technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes Previous experience in a presales environment delivering technical and value based presentations and demos Previous experience in one of the following: Java, Python, Ruby, Go, Node.JS, PHP, or .NET Customer support or customer facing experience in any industry Fluent in Spanish or Portuguese Why You Should Apply: Generous and competitive global and US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $80,000 - $110,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The Team We are a fast-moving, analytically-focused B2B marketing team. We show innovative companies how they can improve their applications and get to market faster. We execute hundreds of events, thousands of marketing campaigns, research and evangelize ideas that move our industry forward, and more. The Opportunity Are you a compelling storyteller to business and multiple kinds of technical audiences? Do you think customers are at the core of every successful marketing strategy? Do you thrive in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment? If so, we’d love to talk to you! Datadog is one of the fastest growing SaaS companies in history. We are building out our Corporate Marketing function, and seeking a passionate customer marketing professional to be part of the next chapter of growth for our global marketing teams. What You’ll Do Collaborate with sales, customer success and product marketing teams to promote, plan and develop of all forms of customer success story content, including company wide visibility and consumption via video, intranet posts, infographics, slide decks, media and analyst interviews Work directly with our most strategic accounts and technical users to capture impactful customer success stories for use by Marketing and Sales Harness Datadog’s existing customer engagement to influence future customers through in-flight deal discussions and external review sites e.g. TrustRadius, Gartner Peer Insights, G2, etc. Support deal acceleration and scale Datadog’s global customer reference function by implementing online tools and resources Scale Datadog’s customer marketing program, helping to cultivate senior advocates within our customer base and building integrated campaigns to ‘show, not tell’ their success Who You Are: An experienced marketing professional with 5+ years of experience in Customer Marketing Have hands-on experience building both business and technology narratives, ideally within the enterprise technology landscape e.g. API Management, APM, Cloud Security, DevOps etc. Able to lead through influence by establishing strong, collaborative relationships across sales, product and marketing leaders Compelling written and oral communication and storytelling skills Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Professional development, product training, and career pathing New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Competitive global benefits, including a Pet Adoption Subsidy Giving programs The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $107,000 - $143,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The Revenue Data Engineering Teams create the data processing pipelines that measure our customers’ usage across all Datadog products, providing vital insights to a broad variety of users and internal stakeholders. This group of teams is at the leading edge of any new product we release. As a Data Engineer you will work with Spark and big data tooling to build highly reliable, verifiably-accurate data processing pipelines for a large-scale mission-critical process. Each day we’re processing trillions of data points and petabytes of data to enable critical decision making processes for Datadog and our users. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Build sophisticated high-volume data pipelines that power the Revenue Platforms Use Spark, Luigi and other open-source technologies Work across the stack, moving fluidly between programming languages: Scala, Python and more Join a tightly knit team solving hard problems the right way Join the Data Engineering community at Datadog and help create and set standards and systems that allow sustainable and organic growth Own meaningful parts of our processing infrastructure, have an impact, grow with the company Who You Are: You have a BS/MS/PhD in a Computer Science, Engineering or related scientific field or equivalent professional experience Experienced in building and operating data pipelines for real customers in production systems Fluent in several programming languages (JVM & otherwise) Skilled in wrangling huge amounts of data and enjoy exploring new data sets Someone who values code simplicity and performance Interested in working in a fast-paced, high growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Competitive global benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $130,000 - $300,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The Revenue Data Engineering Teams create the data processing pipelines that measure our customers’ usage across all Datadog products, providing vital insights to a broad variety of users and internal stakeholders. This group of teams is at the leading edge of any new product we release. As a Data Engineer you will work with Spark and big data tooling to build highly reliable, verifiably-accurate data processing pipelines for a large-scale mission-critical process. Each day we’re processing trillions of data points and petabytes of data to enable critical decision making processes for Datadog and our users. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Build sophisticated high-volume data pipelines that power the Revenue Platforms Use Spark, Luigi and other open-source technologies Work across the stack, moving fluidly between programming languages: Scala, Python and more Join a tightly knit team solving hard problems the right way Join the Data Engineering community at Datadog and help create and set standards and systems that allow sustainable and organic growth Own meaningful parts of our processing infrastructure, have an impact, grow with the company Who You Are: You have a BS/MS/PhD in a Computer Science, Engineering or related scientific field or equivalent professional experience Experienced in building and operating data pipelines for real customers in production systems Fluent in several programming languages (JVM & otherwise) Skilled in wrangling huge amounts of data and enjoy exploring new data sets Someone who values code simplicity and performance Interested in working in a fast-paced, high growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. Datadog is looking for a DEI Training Manager to design, deliver, and drive impact through learning programs that advance the company’s performance and strengthen our culture. This role is critical to the execution and expansion of organization-wide learning initiatives as we rapidly scale. You will have the opportunity to make a big impact at Datadog by building out global training programs that support our DEI (diversity, equity, and inclusion) business goals. You will help unlock the potential of current and future Datadogs by empowering them to upskill through connection, discussion, and practice in a variety of learning environments (e.g., live collaborative workshops, individual coaching, etc.). Critical focuses of this role include instructional design, live in-person and virtual facilitation, and measurement of outcomes to ensure program success. This role will also involve partnering with stakeholders across the business and within the People team to design and evaluate the effectiveness of our programming. In addition to your primary DEI focus, there will be additional opportunities to facilitate manager development content and general L&D workshops to all employees. The successful candidate will be able to hit the ground running by quickly building relationships with stakeholders at all levels, gaining an understanding of the unique characteristics of our people and culture, and beginning to design and build new DEI workshop offerings that will become available to our team in 2023. Additionally, they will learn and confidently facilitate existing workshop content on topics like manager development and other topics. This person will own large scale projects from conception and ensure our programs result in measurable employee behavior change. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do Develop and deliver innovative, interactive, and high-quality DEI learning experiences from the ground up working with our internal DEI leadership and team Collaborate with leaders and SMEs across the business to define our DEI learning objectives and design content and programming that meets those goals Facilitate instructor-led workshops and other live learning moments that drive lasting behavior change for employees across all geographies, departments, and levels (up to C-Suite executives) up to 75% of the time Run each session with clarity, credibility, captivation, curiosity, and calmness Partner with key stakeholders and leadership to measure the real business impact of our DEI programs and ensure their success. Improve the design and/or content of our offerings as necessary Contribute to other programs such as manager development and all staff learning events that help us recruit, develop, and retain top talent Who You Are: 8+ years professional experience in L&D, Talent Development, or a related field, with at least 5+ years facilitating instructor-led workshops to employees at all levels (including senior leadership populations of VPs+) Experience developing and designing effective DEI training programs for global populations. Bonus: Experience building or facilitating people management content Exceptional facilitation and communication skills that are equally effective in in-person and virtual learning environments Demonstrated ability to build credibility and relationships with individuals across all levels, departments, and geographies Demonstrated ability to influence change and drive measurable impact from training Ability to regularly travel to different offices, both domestic and international, to facilitate in-person workshops. Availability to facilitate periodic virtual sessions outside of regular business hours (e.g., 8-10pm EST) to accommodate employees around the world Ability to work from our New York City office at least 3 days per week Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. The Opportunity: Datadog is seeking a talented Corporate Development & Ventures professional to generate, manage, and execute mergers and acquisitions, equity investments, and strategic partnerships for Datadog. You will be a key partner to Datadog’s senior leadership and highly visible at the most senior levels of Datadog. The role is reporting into the Head of Corporate Development and falls within the Product organization. We are looking for an innovative and strategic thinker who is passionate about Datadog and the future of cloud security services. The ideal candidate enjoys solving complex problems, works effectively with cross-functional teams, and thrives in a fast-paced setting that is constantly evolving. Superb negotiation skills are essential. This role includes managing relationships that may be unconventional in nature, need a centralized advocate, and have broad implications across Datadog. As a Director, Customer Success, you will hire and develop multiple teams, coaching first line managers and individual contributors to success. This role ultimately impacts our customer experience and retention at scale. This is an opportunity to join a company that’s a leader in the space and immediately witness your contributions. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. You Will: Develop and maintain accurate team forecasts Coach and guide teams through renewal and expansion negotiations Take ultimate ownership of all account relationships and manage customer and team escalations Motivate teams that proactively foster customer relationships to achieve trust and revenue growth on a consistent basis Invest in building a set of proactive managers that focus on effective communication both internally & externally Prioritize talent attraction, retention, and development; ultimately creating an eco-system of high performing teams Manage competing priorities in an ever-changing environment, displaying ruthless prioritization Who You Are: Someone with 2+ years managing managers, and 2+ years prior to that overseeing a high performing team of Customer Success Managers Experienced in Customer Success or Account Management, 8+ years of experience preferred with a minimum 3 years in the SaaS space Proven track record of success in negotiating contract terms and overcoming pricing objections for renewal and up-sell opportunities Familiar with the B2B tech space or with subscription based software preferred Benefits and Growth: Best-in-breed onboarding Sales training in MEDDIC and Command of the Message An inclusive company culture, opportunity to join our Community Guilds Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing New hire stock equity (RSU) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Generous global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $141,000 - $170,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Director of Central GTM Operations Strategy and Execution
jobDescription: The Team: This Central GTM Operations Team owns the operational strategy for GTM operations end-to-end, from vision to execution, driving innovation and re-imagining our processes and tools at a global scale while also owning vital business processes. Our mission is to be a step-change multiplier to the entire GTM organization by making it easier to do their jobs, spend more time with current and potential customers, and increase revenue. The scope of the team spans Salesforce.com design, global GTM overlay strategy & operations, sales and customer success tools/processes (e.g., Clari, Groove, pursuit planning, Gainsight), sales ops tools (e.g., Fullcast/Anaplan/Adaptive), ops execution, RPA automation, sales policies, enterprise data management and analytics, shared services, and more. The Opportunity: Datadog is seeking a senior GTM strategy and operations leader to scale our business 10x over the next few years as the global head of our Central GTM Operations Team. The leader will define the future of central operations for Datadog, building and leading multiple teams critical to our future business success. We are looking for a dynamic and bold leader to challenge the status quo and help us achieve material incremental revenue while improving productivity and day-to-day experiences through a focus on simplicity and scale. The successful candidate will innovate upon our existing foundational operations and proactively introduce new best-practice capabilities to set up the entire company for long-term success. This leader will outline and deliver the strategy across our GTM operational roadmap, including priorities around innovating via automation, centralizing transactional work and analytics via shared services, innovating streamlined enterprise technologies including data management, redesigning global ROE, standardizing revenue ops processes, and designing next-level global sales tools design in a hyper growth company. The role will have regular interactions with our C-suite and regional leadership with constant collaboration across sales, GTM strategy, customer success, marketing, sales enablement, systems, and more. You Will: Outline and own GTM operations scaling strategy end-to-end Gain executive alignment and funding for your strategy and vision Build and lead multiple teams to design and execute global transformation across vital initiatives, processes, and tools Bring world-class innovation to drive material and measurable impact across the field Inspire a team of direct reports to accomplish amazing things while leaving them better than you found them through a focus on growth mindset Proactively identify new opportunities to improve the daily experience for all of the GTM org and make it easier to win Seamlessly manage team to execute day-to-day GTM operations vital for business continuity Oversee GTM strategy and operations globally for overlay teams such as channels and alliances You bring: BA/BS required; MBA preferred 8+ years of relevant experience in GTM strategy and operations, prior management consulting experience a plus 3+ years of people management experience History of building exceptional GTM operations teams with ownership for driving 10x ops scaling strategy and successful execution within a couple of years Success collaborating across teams and regions to achieve standardization and drive enablement across the field (pull vs. push strategies to help reps more effectively sell) Strong planning, project management, prioritization, and organization skills Excellent attention to detail with an ability to zoom out and be 80/20 where needed Significant experience using a hypothesis and data-driven approach to problem solving and persuading executives around a case for change Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, along with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment while having some fun and rolling up sleeves at the same time Why You Should Apply: Continuous training and career growth New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Generous and competitive US benefits Friendly and inclusive workplace culture The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $178,000 - $261,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. About Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. As a Director, Product Management - Service Management, you will work with a team of product managers and engineers to build a product that our customers use to actively maintain the health of the services they deliver. Datadog is well-known for observability products but what happens when that telemetry points to service degradation? You will need to provide the tools and signal processing to bring sanity to change management and ongoing maintenance of the most sophisticated distributed systems in the world – written by thousands of engineers, comprising tens of thousands of micro-services and deployed to hundreds of thousands of hosts across all major cloud providers and private data centers. Invariably these systems will fail in new and unexpected ways, and your product will also facilitate a team’s response in urgent, high-stress situations. Service Management will complement both our performance monitoring and security businesses. This is a large market with mostly legacy competition, and this is the perfect time to address the needs of the enterprise as it moves into the cloud and to capture existing budgets. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Develop a deep understanding of our customers and market. Work with world-class Product and Engineering teams to develop and evangelize product priorities and roadmaps that inspire our teams’ best work and deliver real value Manage and grow both manager and IC PMs, ensuring they’re happy, motivated, and delivering high quality work Source candidates and help us grow the Product Management team Support and empower the Sales, Account Management, Marketing and Solutions teams to ensure the broadest reach and the best possible customer experience Contribute to a culture of learning and collaboration across the department and broader organization Who You Are: An experienced leader in Product Management, ideally at a SaaS company with strong sense of Infrastructure monitoring and an obsession with solving customer problems to grow the business You have either worked as an engineer previously or have extensive technical knowledge to be able to discuss technical concepts with customers and internally (optionally) Are aware of ITIL and other ITSM tools and have opinions about their ability to address cloud environments. You have Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the willingness to present and defend your ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences You are customer-minded with a high quality standard for the product to be delivered Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The Director of Technical Curriculum Development reports to and works closely with the VP of Technical Community to support the success of the team, responsible for our customer facing education program, including the Datadog Learning Center, workshops, and certifications. Engineering Manager I - Data Science The mission of the Data Science team is to improve observability, efficiency, security, and drive business growth for Datadog customers by augmenting Datadog products with smarter and differentiated solutions. This includes designing and building algorithmically driven features in the Datadog app. We work across a range of applications, primarily focusing on analysis on streaming data such as anomaly detection, error outliers and faulty deployment analysis. The Opportunity As an Engineering Manager I in the Data Science org, you will lead and grow a team of Data Scientists and Software Engineers to help build and improve the growing suite of Watchdog products and features. You will work closely with our engineering and product partners to prioritize and solve high-impact customer problems by augmenting Datadog products with Watchdog features. You’ll be responsible for the strategy and execution of the product while developing and growing a team of talented engineers and data scientists. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Lead and develop a talented team of software engineers and data scientists, who are responsible for building the product, including data collection, data processing and serving, and data visualization Lead the team on developing machine learning and statistical algorithms to help our customers learn from their data and make better decisions in real-time. Collaborate with stakeholder teams to develop joint roadmaps that provide the underlying primitives required to execute the vision of the product Work closely with product management and design teams to create intuitive, powerful and beautiful user workflows that best leverage the vast amount of information being collected Ensure the development and continuous improvement of a scalable and reliable architecture that can keep up with the growth of the product in a sustainable manner Who You Are: You have 2+ years management experience, managing software engineers and/or data scientists You have 5+ years of work experience with data science, backend engineering or machine learning engineering. Experienced in working and communicating effectively in a fast-paced, high growth, distributed organization You have partnered with product management and design teams in the past to set the vision and strategy for your projects You have a track record of motivating teams by setting clear and ambitious goals, and providing the support and coaching required to achieve them You have worked on large scale distributed systems and/or real-time data processing pipelines Datadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. Engineering Manager I - Data Science The mission of the Data Science team is to improve observability, efficiency, security, and drive business growth for Datadog customers by augmenting Datadog products with smarter and differentiated solutions. This includes designing and building algorithmically driven features in the Datadog app. We work across a range of applications, primarily focusing on analysis on streaming data such as anomaly detection, error outliers and faulty deployment analysis. The Opportunity As an Engineering Manager I in the Data Science org, you will lead and grow a team of Data Scientists and Software Engineers to help build and improve the growing suite of Watchdog products and features. You will work closely with our engineering and product partners to prioritize and solve high-impact customer problems by augmenting Datadog products with Watchdog features. You’ll be responsible for the strategy and execution of the product while developing and growing a team of talented engineers and data scientists. jobTitle: Engineering Manager I, Detection Engineering, Product
jobDescription: The Team: The Product Detection Engineering team at Datadog develops impactful threat and vulnerability detection content for Datadog’s portfolio of Cloud Security Platform products. As part of the Security Research organization, you will join a diverse team of hackers and builders who launch impactful security products and research via cross-company collaboration, partnerships with the security community and open source initiatives. We are looking for a Detection Engineering Manager to lead the Cloud Workload Security (CWS) Detection Engineering team at Datadog. Our Cloud Workload Security product protects Linux hosts and containers in our customers’ production cloud environments from threats observed at runtime via our eBPF agent. We’re taking a new approach to cloud security at Datadog by leveraging detailed observability data in a cloud-native way. This detailed observability data has been used by DevOps teams successfully since our inception, and now Datadog is helping Security teams with their use case. You’ll join at an ideal time to make a big impact as the product is seeing very high growth, with many new features to build as well as a need for scaling up dramatically. You Will: Develop and lead a team of talented security practitioners who are responsible for building and continuously improving high quality detections in the CWS product Track, research, and experiment with the latest tactics, techniques & procedures for attacking and defending cloud runtime environments. Operationalize that experience into actionable detection monitoring Partner with the broader Security Research & Detection Engineering organization to build and drive collaborative detection, research and thought leadership efforts Partner with Datadog’s Product Management team to create, prioritize and provide feedback on product features and a roadmap and backlog of detection and response content Create, track and iterate on metrics that showcase the efficacy of your team to leadership across Datadog Collaborate with highly technical customers, listen to their needs, and work with your team to help solve their problems at scale Evangelize your team’s mission and regularly communicate with teams outside of your organizational structure Create, write, and deliver content for our community, such as blog posts, documentation, webinars, and workshops. Present at conferences to highlight the challenges and successes in the field You Are: A proven leader with experience in building out security engineering, detection engineer or security research teams Passionate about building products that make a meaningful impact on customer’s security posture You are comfortable with DevOps concepts surrounding cloud environments and can build an environment to test attacks and detections You have deep knowledge of the Linux operating system and are curious to identify threats in large scale cloud workload environments You have experience measuring the efficacy of security content and communicating those metrics to stakeholders Motivating, kind and humble people leader who focuses on growth and happiness for your team. You have the ability to grow talent by providing a proper mentorship and performance management environment while prioritizing empathy Excited to focus on building a diverse and inclusive organization Understanding of the value of driving efficiencies and partnerships with external teams You have demonstrated experience in talking to customers and designing solutions that meet their needs at scale You want to work in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment You are confident representing your ideas and opinions in a manner that can be challenged and respond to feedback well Why You Should Apply: Generous and competitive global and US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $187,000 - $240,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. About Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. jobTitle: Engineering Manager II, Release Tracking Tools
jobDescription: This is an opportunity to lead an effort that involves building a team to provide Datadog customers with better visibility and confidence when it comes to releasing new features and deployments. The role involves working across various product teams and building end to end products and features. It presents plenty of scope for project and career growth and an opportunity to lead overall architecture and build foundational components, while also hiring and growing the team and driving the team culture. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Lead and build a talented team of software engineers, who are responsible for building the end to end product, including data collection, APIs, and data visualization and user experience. Play an active role in recruiting and coaching and grooming new leaders to help grow the team into multiple sub-teams over time Lead the team on developing features and products to help customers measure the impact of making changes or releasing new features Work with the team and its partners to define vision, strategy, and roadmap, and work to help both junior and senior engineers address the challenges of implementing them, advancing their careers while producing high quality software Partner closely with product management and design teams to develop intuitive, powerful and beautiful user workflows that best leverage the vast amount of information being collected Ensure the development and continuous improvement of a scalable and reliable architecture that can keep up with the growth of the product in a sustainable manner Who You Are: You have experience in building and growing teams, and have 3+ years management experience, including managing managers of one or more teams. You have experience in building distributed systems, including understanding of Observability systems. You have 5+ years of work experience building high-scale, distributed systems. You have experience in working and communicating effectively in a fast-paced, high growth, distributed organization You have partnered with product management and design teams in the past to set the vision and strategy for your projects You have a track record of motivating teams by setting clear and ambitious goals, and providing the support and coaching required to achieve them Datadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. Benefits & Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The Team: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. Technical solutions is a growing global team that collaborates constantly to share knowledge and continuously advance our technical skillset. The Opportunity: Sales engineers help qualify and close opportunities with customers and partners. You will provide technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, and supporting technical evaluations (POVs). SEs also have a voice with the product team to help prioritize features based on input from customers, competitors, and partners. You Will: Partner with the Sales Team to articulate the overall Datadog value proposition, vision and strategy to customers Own technical engagement with customers during the trial phase. Communicate Datadog’s value based on activities and work with customers on any identified issues or concerns to successful conclusion Technically close complex opportunities through advanced competitive knowledge, technical skill, and credibility Deliver product and technical briefings / presentations to potential clients Maintain accurate notes and feedback in CRM regarding customer input both wins and losses Proactively engage and communicate with customers and Datadog business/technical teams regarding product feedback and competitive landscape You Are: Passionate about educating customers on observability risks that are meaningful to their business Able to build and execute an evaluation plan with a customer Exceptional at written and oral communication skills. This role requires an ability to understand and articulate both the business benefits (value proposition) and technical advantages of our offering Experienced in programming/scripting with any of the following: Java, Python, Ruby, Go, Node.JS, PHP, and .NET etc. Someone with a minimum of 3 years in a Sales engineering or DevOps engineering role. Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 45% of the time Bonus Points: Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher, Mesos or other container technologies. Experience in systems administration: Windows, Linux Strong knowledge of current infrastructure and monitoring solutions and technologies. The Team: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. Technical solutions is a growing global team that collaborates constantly to share knowledge and continuously advance our technical skillset. The Opportunity: Sales engineers help qualify and close opportunities with customers and partners. You will provide technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, and supporting technical evaluations (POVs). SEs also have a voice with the product team to help prioritize features based on input from customers, competitors, and partners. You Will: Partner with the Sales Team to articulate the overall Datadog value proposition, vision and strategy to customers Own technical engagement with customers during the trial phase. Communicate Datadog’s value based on activities and work with customers on any identified issues or concerns to successful conclusion Technically close complex opportunities through advanced competitive knowledge, technical skill, and credibility Deliver product and technical briefings / presentations to potential clients Maintain accurate notes and feedback in CRM regarding customer input both wins and losses Proactively engage and communicate with customers and Datadog business/technical teams regarding product feedback and competitive landscape You Are: Passionate about educating customers on observability risks that are meaningful to their business Able to build and execute an evaluation plan with a customer Exceptional at written and oral communication skills. This role requires an ability to understand and articulate both the business benefits (value proposition) and technical advantages of our offering Experienced in programming/scripting with any of the following: Java, Python, Ruby, Go, Node.JS, PHP, and .NET etc. Someone with a minimum of 3 years in a Sales engineering or DevOps engineering role. Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 45% of the time Bonus Points: Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher, Mesos or other container technologies. Experience in systems administration: Windows, Linux Strong knowledge of current infrastructure and monitoring solutions and technologies. Why You Should Apply: Generous and competitive global and US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $98,000 - $143,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Enterprise Technology Engineer, Enterprise Engineering - Integrations
jobDescription: Enterprise Engineering - Integrations is a global team of IT Systems Engineers building high volume, resilient data pipelines and service integrations that allow disparate systems to communicate seamlessly. We create and manage data pipelines that connect our employee HRIS to multiple downstream services such as Slack, Atlassian, Github, and more, ensuring consistent and accurate identity and access management through user metadata and group memberships. Additionally, we build service integrations that manage physical security systems, and many others that keep the Datadog wheels turning. As an IT Systems Engineer on the Enterprise Engineering - Integrations team, you will help us move faster and more efficiently by writing code to connect systems via APIs and custom workflow automations. Datadog is scaling very quickly and we need your help! At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Design and build scalable tools that have company-wide impact Write code to create integrations between disparate cloud services using APIs Own and manage business critical cloud infrastructure and applications Work with security and compliance teams to support compliance efforts Solve new and complex IT challenges Participate in team on-call rotation Who You Are: Someone with significant experience in one or more languages (e.g. Python, Java, Go or Ruby) Someone with significant hands-on experience working with SaaS offerings and their API endpoints Someone with experience designing data pipelines and integrations with high volume and throughput Technical, love automating things and designing for scale Someone with excellent verbal and written communications skills Eager to work in a fast pace, high growth startup environment You have a BS/MS/PhD in a Computer Science, Engineering or related scientific field or equivalent professional experience Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $110,000 - $142,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Enterprise Technology Engineer, Enterprise Engineering - Platform
jobDescription: Enterprise Engineering - Platform is a global team of engineers building custom applications with tailored end-user experiences for Datadog employees. We are responsible for building backend and full stack applications used across Datadog. This includes the user account lifecycle platform which supports employee onboarding, offboarding, account recertification, and SaaS license management, as well as automated equipment procurement and device posture monitoring solutions. As an Enterprise Technology Engineer on the Enterprise Engineering - Platform team, you will help us move faster and more efficiently by writing code to create extensible and scalable platforms used across Datadog. You will build the foundation for some of our most integral automation systems that enable your colleagues to succeed and Datadog to scale. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Collaborate with teams across the organization to identify gaps and design automated solutions to address Datadog’s business needs Build scalable full stack tools that have company-wide impact Add and deploy features to existing applications Participate in a team on-call rotation to troubleshoot and solve issues with our tools Who You Are: Someone with significant experience in one or more languages (e.g. Go, Python), with the interest and drive to learn additional tools and technologies Someone who can gather and translate user requirements into technical implementation Someone with experience designing, building, and deploying scalable end-user applications Someone with excellent verbal and written communications skills, who has experience working with team members asynchronously Datadog values people from all walks of life. As Datadog is growing, the need for platforms (common backends that every product can rely on) is becoming more and more essential. The Event platform is the core intake, processing, storage and query system for all time based event products such as Log Management, APM, Security monitoring, RUM and others. As a Group PM of the Event Platform, you will be leading the current team of 2 PMs to make this critical platform always easier to onboard new products as well as expanding its capabilities to address the most advanced requirements of Datadog products. You’ll join at an ideal time to make a big impact, the platform is seeing very high and steady growth, with many new features to build as well as a need for scaling up dramatically. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. jobDescription: Our Serverless Monitoring team builds products that help developers and ops teams monitor and secure serverless applications built with AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Run, Azure Functions, and other serverless platforms. This includes libraries and tools for instrumenting serverless applications as well as dedicated user interfaces in the Datadog app. As the Group Product Manager for Serverless, you’ll own the vision, strategy, and execution for Datadog’s serverless solutions. You’ll manage a team of PMs and ensure that Datadog remains a leader in this rapidly growing and evolving category. You’ll work closely with a diverse set of customers to understand how they’re adopting serverless and how we can help them. You’ll partner with other Datadog product teams to ensure their products work well for serverless applications, and you’ll lead conversations with partners in the serverless ecosystem including the public cloud providers and other SaaS companies. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Be accountable for the growth of Datadog’s serverless solutions Gather insights from customers, partners, analysts, and internal data to become an expert on the serverless ecosystem and market trends Define the vision, strategy, and product roadmap — including what platforms to support and what solutions to provide Manage a team of PMs to deliver on the roadmap and ensure it creates value for customers and Datadog Partner with Marketing and other GTM teams to generate awareness and drive adoption of Datadog’s solutions Who You Are: 7+ years of experience in B2B SaaS Product Management (ideally on a developer-focused product) Proven ability to launch and grow products in an emerging category Possess a deep understanding (and interest) in software development and emerging technologies Hands on experience using services from one or more of the major cloud providers (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) Prior experience managing multiple product managers Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. jobTitle: GTM Strategy and Operations Senior Associate (Customer GTM)
jobDescription: The Team: The GTM Strategy & Operations Senior Associate will join a global team driving Datadog’s next phase of growth. We’re interdisciplinary thinkers leveraging diverse business backgrounds in management consulting, investment banking, business development, and tech to accelerate Datadog’s global growth. You Will: Develop strategic plans for our business and operating divisions, both short-term (<12 mo) and long-term (>24 mo) - from creating high-level recommendations (e.g. setting headcount and KPI targets) to leading new operational initiatives (e.g. defining new business priorities, driving special projects to accelerate revenue, designing incentive structures to achieve targets) Generate quantitative analytics and qualitative insights on how to improve the business , while maintaining business effectiveness & efficiency Independently design, launch and lead global transformations programs and deliver improvements to our operating model; own the success outcomes and progress reporting to leadership. jobTitle: GTM Strategy and Operations Senior Associate (Data Analyst)
jobDescription: GTM Sales Strategy & Operations Senior Associate, Data Analyst The Opportunity We’re looking for an experienced Senior Associate to join our growing GTM Strategy & Operations Scaling team. Our team owns complex problems that require insight, creativity, and execution to build scalable processes, tools, and systems for our rapidly growing global business. You will help ensure that our CRM environment contains Sales data which is accurate, complete, and fit-for-use from an ever increasing source of internal and external data sources. Doing this successfully requires leveraging vendor tools and technical solutions (e.g., SQL, Python) to design, implement, and execute data quality strategies and routines. You will also work with a wide range of key stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions. You Will Build and automate data quality controls and algorithms to support master data management operations Collaborate with our Sales Organization to help determine root-causes of quality issues and proactively remediate Develop reports and dashboards to measure and monitor data improvements that lead to actionable insights Leverage vendor tools and technical solutions (e.g., SQL, Python) to detect and flag quality issues for Sales data (e.g., Accounts, Contacts) in CRM environment Create rules and processes to proactively identify and action on data quality issues Requirements Bachelor's Degree 3-5 years of experience in Data Analytics / Data Management / Data Quality 2-3 years of experience supporting sales teams and / or working with Salesforce CRM Significant demonstrable work experience leveraging SQL and Python You are a self-starter and highly motivated Organized and results-oriented with excellent attention to detail You are a Learner - you enjoy learning new things and apply to your day to day Effective communicator, both written and verbal You enjoy collaborating with others and solving problems The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $124,000.00 - $165,000.00, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation.
