Datadog is seeking a HRIS Integrations Architect who will be responsible for owning and managing all Workday related integrations. This hands-on technical role demands excellent knowledge of HR business processes and Workday Integration technologies. This role will be responsible for all phases of the integration lifecycle. The candidate should have experience developing and supporting Workday HCM, benefits, and payroll using the various Workday integration tools. You will play a critical role in the continued deployment of new functionality, developing solutions and enabling the continued growth of Datadog. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Responsible for the ownership of the ongoing design, deployment, maintenance, and governance of the HRIS Integrations landscape and roadmap. Develop integration architecture and data platform, propose integration development guidelines and recommend best practices Design and build integrations between Workday and various internal and external systems using Workday technologies such as Studio, EIBs, Core Connectors, Web Services, etc. partnering with internal and external stakeholders Analyze the current integration landscape to identify gaps in functionality or areas for improvement around performance, error handling, and scalability Monitor scheduled integrations and handle integration failures, errors, or issues; work with vendors to resolve as necessary Responsible for the overall Workday Integration delivery and maintaining integration standard operating procedures Serve as a technical advisor on our most complex issues regarding Workday APIs, security, authentication and integration solutions, providing technical knowledge and answers to questions regarding their use. Partner with internal and external stakeholders to solve business issues through automation Who You Are: 7+ years of hands-on experience building and supporting Workday integrations. Workday Integration Certified, strongly preferred but not required. Experience with Workday Extend and/or Prism a plus Knowledge of HR functional areas (Recruiting, Hiring, Onboarding, Benefits, Compensation, Learning, Performance/Talent, etc.) Extensive knowledge and experience of Workday Studio, EIBs, Core Connectors, PECI, Cloud Connectors, Document Transformation, and BIRT. Strong understanding of Workday SOAP and REST web service directories and related security domains Coding experience (C++, C#, Java, .NET, XML/XMLT/XSLT) required and knowledge with SQL databases and writing SQL queries Experience with Web Service or ESBs products (SnapLogic, Boomi, MuleSoft, Informatica, etc.) and experience building and supporting integrations with ADP Celergo, Greenhouse, and various benefit vendors Computer Science degree/previous development experience a plus (but not required) Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. This is a remote position The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $150,000 - $220,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way. The Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) team works within the Information Security organization and across Datadog to implement, monitor, and continuously improve Datadog’s security, risk, and compliance programs. As an Information Security Analyst, you will support our SOX program. You will work with Datadog’s Internal Audit team to define the SOX scope and create ITGCs to support meeting Datadog’s SOX obligations. You will work with Engineering and Finance teams to implement an appropriate control framework, provide support where applicable, and remediate identified issues. You will also own and manage User Access Reviews which are conducted quarterly across a variety of mostly SaaS based systems. What you will do: Serve as a key liaison and manage expectations between internal teams (including Engineering) and internal/external auditors. Lead the successful completion of the quarterly UAR (User Access Review) audit process. Create and/or remediate ITGC (IT General Controls) in support of meeting audit objectives for all ITGC SOX areas. Design IT testing procedures to identify and evaluate risk exposures and determine the effectiveness and efficiency of controls, particularly for new system or process control readiness. Assist with the creation of effective remediation solutions and/or exception documentation where applicable. Serve as the SOX Compliance subject matter expert and point of contact to Internal and External Auditors. Assist technical teams with creation and implementation of IT controls objectives. Who you are: Minimum of 5-10 years’ work experience in IT Risk Management, SOX compliance and auditing with a strong background in IT controls. A background in auditing SaaS based tech (AWS, GCP, Azure, and other SaaS based vendors like Salesforce, Workday, ServiceNow, etc.). Expert understanding of Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) and other compliance requirements that may impact compliance. Experience developing, and implementing security and control solutions that address SOX requirements. Ability to effectively mentor other team members as needed. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $89,000 - $215,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way. The Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) team works within the Information Security organization and across Datadog to implement, monitor, and continuously improve Datadog’s security, risk, and compliance programs. As an Information Security Analyst, you will support our SOX program. You will work with Datadog’s Internal Audit team to define the SOX scope and create ITGCs to support meeting Datadog’s SOX obligations. You will work with Engineering and Finance teams to implement an appropriate control framework, provide support where applicable, and remediate identified issues. You will also own and manage User Access Reviews which are conducted quarterly across a variety of mostly SaaS based systems. What you will do: Serve as a key liaison and manage expectations between internal teams (including Engineering) and internal/external auditors. Lead the successful completion of the quarterly UAR (User Access Review) audit process. Create and/or remediate ITGC (IT General Controls) in support of meeting audit objectives for all ITGC SOX areas. Design IT testing procedures to identify and evaluate risk exposures and determine the effectiveness and efficiency of controls, particularly for new system or process control readiness. Assist with the creation of effective remediation solutions and/or exception documentation where applicable. Serve as the SOX Compliance subject matter expert and point of contact to Internal and External Auditors. Assist technical teams with creation and implementation of IT controls objectives. Who you are: Minimum of 5-10 years’ work experience in IT Risk Management, SOX compliance and auditing with a strong background in IT controls. A background in auditing SaaS based tech (AWS, GCP, Azure, and other SaaS based vendors like Salesforce, Workday, ServiceNow, etc.). Expert understanding of Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) and other compliance requirements that may impact compliance. Experience developing, and implementing security and control solutions that address SOX requirements. Ability to effectively mentor other team members as needed. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. jobTitle: Internal Product Owner - Application Data Platforms
jobDescription: We’re looking for a Product Owner with a passion for Application Data Platforms (ADP) and providing easy to use, safe, and scalable datastores for Datadog. We do this by providing subject matter expertise, consulting, support, and tooling for many of the existing datastores at Datadog and by providing a growing set of managed services which make common datastore use cases solved problems for the teams we support. As an Internal Product Owner in the Application Data Platforms group, you will shape the vision and direction of our core data storage, including our globally replicated data infrastructure, mission critical platforms like Postgres and Cassandra, as well as higher level offerings for common data storage patterns. You will partner with engineering, product, and design teams across Datadog to deeply understand how they work, what they need, and what we can provide. You will bring a user obsessed attitude that is passionate about building world class engineering experiences. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Drive the vision of the infrastructure Datadog engineers use to store and access application data Identify needs and opportunities across the Datadog engineering organization Establish key metrics that measure the effectiveness of our systems Identify opportunities to integrate our internal systems with other parts of the Datadog ecosystem Provide regular product updates to engineers and other stakeholders Who You Are: Deeply knowledgeable on one more more data storage systems, such as Postgres, Cassandra, Kafka, or Elasticsearch Experienced in defining and growing internally focused services and product offerings Experienced working in large scale environments with high availability requirements User obsessed and empathetic Able to switch between tactical and strategic thinking Comfortable working with deeply technical users You have strong written and verbal communication skills You have prior experience as a technical product manager for developer experience and/or infrastructure tooling Datadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. Benefits & Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global Spring Health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $187,000 - $240,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. About Datadog: We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—providing always-on alerting, metrics visualization, logs, and application tracing for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way. The opportunity: Datadog is building a world-class APM product that traces requests as they flow across complex systems. We are looking for an expert Python developer who can help push our tracing tools to the next level. If you’re passionate about code instrumentation, and excited about building high scale Application Performance and Application Security products, then this opportunity is for you. Come and join us to build amazing open source software. You will: Write open source code that instruments thousands of Python applications around the world. Drive our open source Python projects and engage with the community to find and address the most important challenges. Join a great team building software the right way. Requirements: You’re a master Python programmer. You’ve tamed the GIL. You’ve tried gevent, asyncio, tornado or even plain old threading. You are a great community ambassador and can drive hard technical conversations towards a good solution. You have solid experience with widely used frameworks and libraries like Asyncio, Django, Flask, Falcon, or Celery. You want to work in a fast, high growth startup environment. You have a BS/MS/PhD in a STEM field or equivalent experience. Bonus points: You run your applications in PyPy or other interpreter implementations. You have significant experience with Go, Java, JavaScript or Ruby. You have experience with code telemetry and introspection. You have experience with CPython bindings or Cython. jobTitle: Manager 1, Premier Support Engineering - San Francisco
jobDescription: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The Technical Solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers via multi-channel technical support, demos, and presentations. You’ll be joining a team and company where you will be challenged, but also will immediately witness your contributions to Datadog. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Manage, develop, coach and mentor a team of Premier Support Engineers who respond to client requests, reproduce and troubleshoot issues, and dive into Datadog’s 400+ integrations Act as the owner for your team’s accountability and performance - partnering closely with upper management to facilitate performance reviews, performance plans, and any employee relations issues for your direct reports Ensure successful training and onboarding of new hires Guide the team through technical-training, certificates and additional learning and development needs Build out documentation and knowledge base articles for a variety of technologies Drive projects or initiatives to improve team productivity, process, or procedure Collaborate with internal teams and customers on high-priority escalations and act as a resource to resolve escalations from team members as necessary Who You Are: Passionate about people management and/or mentorship with previous experience leading a team Self-motivated, detail-attentive, and have a desire for continuous learning A critical thinker who defaults to a client-centric approach A tinkerer with some programming experience and a basic knowledge of Linux Active contribution to open-source projects (code, bug reports, etc.) and the Engineering Community (Meetups, etc.) Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive global and US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $101,000 - $147,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. Historically, profilers have been used during development or as one-off experiments in non-production environments to optimize programs’ resource usage, latency, or to debug certain problems. The Continuous Profiler team is building a cutting-edge profiling product that has low enough overhead that it can be run continuously in production. This allows users to have much better profiles since they’re based on real workloads at real scale, and can help solve production incidents. Our goal is to help our users reduce their software’s resource usage (saving money and decreasing environmental footprint), decrease latency, and fix bugs. We’re looking for an engineering manager to help build profiling libraries for some of the languages we support, integrating with, and occasionally contributing to, the various language runtimes. You’ll manage 5 talented engineers and do plenty of your own coding. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: We build profilers for .NET, C/C++/Rust, Go, Java, Node, PHP, Python, and Ruby. We already have one Team Lead for the client components and you’ll be their peer, leading half of the folks working on these. This is a hybrid role: you’ll spend ~half your time on management, and the rest doing hands-on technical work. You’ll work with and mentor the engineers on your team. This might mean reviewing an RFC or discussing areas where they want to grow or have gaps, and supporting them in developing those skills. You’ll help foster a high-performance and fun culture. You’ll contribute to our profiling libraries – adding cutting-edge functionality and debugging tricky problems. You’ll help us continue to raise the bar on the quality of our code and the stability of our profilers. You’ll help define priorities and build out the roadmap, along with your team, product manager, and other stakeholders. Who You Are: You have excellent communication skills and are emotionally intelligent. You have deep knowledge of at least one of the languages we support. Bonus points if it’s Java, Node, Python, or Ruby. You also know C or C++ and have experience working with subtle concurrency constraints. You’re attentive to details and can build software with very low defect rates. You appreciate simplicity as a tool to accomplish this. You’ve used profilers or done other forms of performance engineering and know how to write efficient software. It’d be nice if you have experience hacking on language runtimes or writing low-level language or systems tools like profilers, compilers, debuggers, or OSes. You’re interested in an environment that values shipping early and iterating, and keeping process to the minimum needed to ensure safety. You enjoy owning projects and can keep moving forward despite the occasional ambiguity or blocker. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Skilled, knowledgeable, and kind teammates to work with and learn from. Interesting challenges of all sorts. You’ll gain experience with low overhead sampling profilers, runtime internals, low level OS details, and how to safely ship software that runs within customer processes at scale. Opportunities to contribute to open source software, like language runtimes. You’ll have a lot of influence on product direction and impact on the business, especially since we continue to grow quickly. Competitive global benefits. Continuous professional development. Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. We’re looking for an experienced Manager to lead and grow a team of engineers working at the intersection of multiple scaling challenges in our Revenue Engineering organization. The Revenue Query team is responsible for the ingestion, storage, and retrieval systems that serve a growing suite of datasets to consumers across our multi-cloud platform. These datasets and APIs provide insight into usage, billing, and revenue information across all of Datadog’s customers, products, and features. This team is responsible for creating a cross-cloud and cross-region data access platform that will scale along with our business to the next order of magnitude. The team has a full-stack, hands-on culture, and solves problems from the infrastructure level (deployment, database architecture, infrastructure-as-code) up to the interface layer (designing and maintaining public-facing database APIs) - and everything in between. The Engineering Manager will work with the team and its partners to define technical strategies and roadmaps, and will work to help both junior and senior engineers meet the challenges of implementing them, advancing their careers while producing high quality software. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Manage and grow teams of talented engineers, ensuring they deliver high quality, timely work and that they’re happy, motivated, and growing Work with Product Managers to establish future plans for features and functionality Work with Technical Program Managers and other engineering leaders around the world to deliver cross-cutting projects (e.g. running in multiple regions and clouds) Scale the systems to accommodate ongoing hypergrowth Contribute to improving quality of life and shaping the future in our engineering organization Coach and challenge engineers at all levels to reach their next milestones in achievement and realize their career goals Who You Are: You have been building complex applications for 6+ years and know the systems you’ve worked on from top to bottom You have experience with containerized applications deployed to Kubernetes or a similar orchestrator You have experience working with database clusters at scale You have managed software engineers both individually and as teams You have architected, built, and operated distributed systems to solve problems at high scale You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent experience You want to work in a fast-paced, high-growth startup environment Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. Manager, Engineering - Streams We’re looking for an Engineering Manager to come in to lead our Streams team and help it grow to the next level. This team is part of the Platform Automation group and maintains the underlying infrastructure for Kafka, which is the message bus for a variety of our internal platforms. Many of the workloads that we run at Datadog are interacting with Kafka to propagate messages across a wide variety of pipelines: Metrics, Event-Platform, Alerting, APM, Profiling and many more products that are part of the Datadog suite. This team is paired closely with other teams in Distributed Data Systems so that we can build common solutions together which support our various platforms. We will be working on an effort to bring standard solutions across multiple teams to support automating away operational burden, with a goal of bringing elasticity at a multi-cloud level. We’re looking for a leader that is technically deep enough to work with this team and bring their domain expertise to identify and prioritize challenging problems with a cross functional approach. You’ll be working closely with Platform Automation teams and teams in the Distributed Data Systems group to build out a reliable next generation platform for our streaming infrastructure. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Own the vision and execution for Streams Help to grow the team into multiple teams over time Partner with other automation and platform teams to find common solutions Help to identify workflows that can be automated in the operational and deployment space Create a roadmap in conjunction with the other Platform Automation teams Who You Are: You’ve managed and lead one or more teams and have shipped successful products Have domain expertise in Kafka or another stream processing system You’re comfortable managing geographically distributed teams You’re adept at motivating people through a combination of clear communication, a track record of successful and rapid execution, and an ambitious vision. You have experience managing operationally heavy teams and you’re willing to share the on-call responsibilities with them. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $234,000 to $300,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. We are seeking an experienced manager to oversee a team of talented marketing operations professionals. This leader will be responsible for prioritizing work, ensuring strategic projects move ahead, and providing mentorship and guidance to the team. Marketing Operations is responsible for flawlessly automating and executing digital marketing campaigns using Marketo. We provide insights into marketing effectiveness through attribution and reporting; and create alignment among people, processes and metrics. If you are excited to work on an analytically driven, fast-moving team where no two days are the same, then we want to meet you. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Build, manage and mentor a small team. This includes: ensuring the team has the information, tools, and support they need to be successful in their roles; enforcing deadlines; assisting with problem-solving; overseeing and balancing workloads; onboarding new hires and helping them develop their skills. Collaborate with leaders across departments on strategic initiatives that drive awareness, lead generation, and growth for Datadog. Provide clear and consistent feedback on the team’s work to ensure it upholds brand standards and that there are no mistakes. Integrate data from disparate systems in order to report effectively on marketing results and drive business decisions. Oversee long term strategic projects such as process automation, database management, and documentation. Who You Are: A professional with 8+ years of experience in marketing operations, 2+ years of management. Someone who has built and scaled diverse and successful marketing teams, with proven examples of coaching and promoting talent from your team. Able to understand marketing operations concepts including workflow management, segmentation, reporting, and the marketing funnel. Able to communicate effectively with other leaders and uphold marketing operations SLAs and processes across teams. Experienced with Marketo or other similar marketing automation tools (Eloqua, Pardot). Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive benefits package New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The Team: Technical Program Managers (TPMs) are responsible for our most challenging cross-team projects. We are highly technical, organized, and deliver projects across ambiguous ownership lines. When we need to update our platform to work with new infrastructure or implement new system-wide capabilities, our TPMs lead the effort. TPMs are responsible for seeing programs through from beginning to end, ensuring a better workflow and more effective communication. They work closely with executives and key company stakeholders to drive critical programs and activities across the company. The Opportunity: As one of the managers in the Technical Program Management team, you will partner with our Engineering leaders to identify opportunities for TPMs to add value by driving large-scale programs. You will utilize your leadership skills and program management experience to grow and mentor a team of TPMs and oversee the breadth of programs led by your team. You’ll be part of the leadership team that sets a vision and direction for the overall TPM team, and help establish standards and practices that best fit the organization. You Will: Need to understand Datadog technology and the challenges our eng teams face Establish credibility and rapport with technical peers Manage a team of TPMs, both team leads and individual contributors, who work on the most technical aspects of Datadog’s infrastructure Take a hands on approach to the work your team delivers, as necessary Help grow the team and develop your team members Have a solid program management background and are able to drive process improvements across multiple teams and functions, ensuring the approach is aligned with Datadog’s culture Able to communicate with senior executives, and be confident in the presence of leaders Be comfortable in an ambiguous environment and respond well to frequent change You Are: 7-10 years experience as a Technical Program Manager, working on cross-organizational projects 5-7 years of experience in leading teams within technical program management or equivalent roles, ideally at a SaaS company Can navigate technical conversations regarding cloud-based infrastructure Thorough understanding of the software development lifecycle; ability to adjust and apply this knowledge in a dynamic environment without advocating for dogmatic practices Strong quantitative and analytical skills, proven ability to track and successfully complete complex programs Degree in Computer Science, other engineering discipline, or Information Systems Bonus Points: You’re familiar with problems that are solved by monitoring tools Experience working in a company in a hyper-growth stage Experience growing a team (identifying roles, partnering with recruiting to hire) Experience as a software engineer The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $221,000 - $282,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. jobTitle: Open Source Software Engineer - Container Ecosystems
jobDescription: The opportunity: Did you discover containers over the past few years, and have you been running them in production ever since? Did you dive into the Docker and Kubernetes code bases or follow the evolution of containers and the CRI with anticipation? Datadog is building world-class container-monitoring solutions that allow correlation between traces, metrics and logs coming from applications, the containers they run in, and the orchestrators that schedule them. We are looking for a developer experienced with the container ecosystem that will help us push container monitoring to the next level. Come join us as you help to build amazing open-source software that will run on thousands of machines and make life easier for technical customers who care deeply about what you build. You will: Build open-source software that monitors containers, their runtimes and other components of the cloud-native ecosystem Participate and contribute to upstream open-source communities Do it in Go, Python, or any language that fits the particular task at hand Design and write features that solve new problems in the industry Have a significant impact on the product and the user experience of fellow engineers who use the product Requirements: You have been working with containers in production for at least a year You have significant systems programming experience in one or more languages You enjoy diving into new code bases, and can get down to low-level when needed You want to work in a fast, high growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent experience Bonus points: You have mastered one or more container orchestrators such as Kubernetes, Mesos, or Nomad You enjoy interacting with the upstream open-source communities, and can drive technical conversations in the open The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $130,000 - $300,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. Are you eager to explore a career in HR? Datadog is scaling, and we are committed to investing in our people. If you are looking to get a ground floor experience in supporting a high-growth tech company as it scales, this is the place to be. You’ll be heavily involved in all things that make it possible for our employees to do great things here contributing to our success. You will have the opportunity to learn and grow from great mentors and will provide front-line support to drive the success of key People initiatives. You will be a trusted member of the global People Team and instrumental in driving efficiency and organization in your day-to-day support. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Serve as the first point of contact for employee questions received through the People Services Team, triaging when necessary. Own the administrative execution of new hire onboarding and offboarding. Own all aspects of maintaining employee changes and data throughout the full employee life cycle including employee changes in the system, organizational updates, job change letters, and audits. Champion collaborative cross functional relationships with Recruiting, IT, Payroll, and hiring managers to ensure a successful hiring process and engaging onboarding experience for new hires. Organize and maintain internal documentation and perform regular audits to ensure accuracy and completeness. Develop and regularly maintain internal knowledge base resources to empower employees to be self-directed and successful. Ensure compliance with company policies and procedures, local, state, and regional regulations. Coordinate and support new hires during the entire onboarding process, ensuring a smooth transition for each new hire Assist with salary and stock administration Who You Are: Curious about a career in human resources and eager to get involved and improve processes such as payroll, benefits, and administrative support Comfortable processing confidential material Someone who maintains a high degree of professionalism Excellent in your oral and written communications skills Detail oriented, organized and able to multitask in a fast-paced environment An expert in Excel with experience in Google for Enterprise 1+ year of HR or related experience Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive benefits package New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $47,000 - $69,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The Team: We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. Technical solutions is a growing global team that collaborates constantly to share knowledge and continuously advance our technical skillset. The Opportunity: Sales engineers help qualify and close opportunities with customers and partners. You will provide technical expertise through sales presentations, product demonstrations, and supporting technical evaluations (POVs). SEs also have a voice with the product team to help prioritize features based on input from customers, competitors, and partners. You Will: Partner with the Sales Team to articulate the overall Datadog value proposition, vision and strategy to customers Own technical engagement with customers during the trial phase. Communicate Datadog’s value based on activities and work with customers on any identified issues or concerns to successful conclusion Technically close complex opportunities through advanced competitive knowledge, technical skill, and credibility Deliver product and technical briefings / presentations to potential clients Maintain accurate notes and feedback in CRM regarding customer input both wins and losses Proactively engage and communicate with customers and Datadog business/technical teams regarding product feedback and competitive landscape You Are: Passionate about educating customers on observability risks that are meaningful to their business Able to build and execute an evaluation plan with a customer Exceptional at written and oral communication skills. This role requires an ability to understand and articulate both the business benefits (value proposition) and technical advantages of our offering Experienced in programming/scripting with any of the following: Java, Python, Ruby, Go, Node.JS, PHP, and .NET etc. Someone with a minimum of 3 years in a Sales engineering or DevOps engineering role. Able to sit up to 4 hours, traveling to and from client sites Able to travel via auto, train or air up to 45% of the time Bonus Points: Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Rancher, Mesos or other container technologies. Experience in systems administration: Windows, Linux Strong knowledge of current infrastructure and monitoring solutions and technologies. We are seeking a motivated lawyer who will serve as a partner and counselor in the room, providing advice to Datadog’s product-related teams and leaders on all phases of the product development life cycle. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Advise Engineering and Product teams on key aspects of their business as well as keep current on relevant industry standards, laws, and regulations. Support product development and deployment by developing and implementing product release checklists, reviewing product releases for issues related to intellectual property, open source, marketing, competition, export control, and other legal and regulatory issues. Review, draft and negotiate technology agreements, including technology partner agreements and product-related consulting, vendor, and development agreements. Support due diligence processes to ensure compliance with third-party agreements and, open-source licenses, security attestations and government regulations and certifications. Coordinate advice with other Legal advisors and cross-functional stakeholders, including Product, Engineering, Marketing, Tax and others. Collaborate with all stakeholders to improve processes and ensure business needs are not just satisfied, but optimized. Who You Are: A law school graduate and attorney with a minimum of 7 years of combined relevant legal experience at a leading law-firm and either a government entity or a technology company. A professional with demonstrated experience advising clients on Software as a Service (SaaS) products and services, preferably including export control-related matters. A member of the New York Bar in good standing (or qualified to register as In-House Counsel with the New York state Bar). A graduate from a technical degree program (ideally related to computer programming) or someone with equivalent professional experience in computer software. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. We’re looking for a data visualization design intern with a passion for building technical tools and data-driven products. Data visualization is core to the Datadog product experience, with a growing number of advanced visualizations for our real-time dashboards and exploratory maps. Our work makes the data we collect easy for users to understand and act on. You’ll join at an ideal time to make a big impact. We are growing rapidly, beginning greenfield projects that are targeted at new user groups, and also refining and expanding on our most impactful existing features. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Work with designers, product managers, and engineers, to understand how our customers use visualizations to reveal insights and troubleshoot issues. See your visualization designs through from start to finish: turn visualization requirements into ideas, sketch and prototype to bring them to life, and propose final features or improvements that make Datadog better. Document and present your visualization designs to the team and work to get buy-in from key stakeholders. Work closely with our data visualization engineers to understand how your designs will be built. Who You Are: You have experience in designing visualizations You have a basic knowledge of building data visualizations with libraries like D3.js Your portfolio includes interactive visualizations You are in the process of receiving a degree, graduating between fall 2023 - summer 2024 You are able to work full-time for at least 12 weeks starting in January 2023 or May 2023 You are an excellent visual and written communicator, able to clearly document and present your design work and speak to the reasoning for your design decisions You understand systems thinking and component-based design patterns You give and receive feedback well, supporting and improving the work of your colleagues as well as your own Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. We’re looking for a product design intern with a passion for building technical tools and data-driven products. Our designers create the UIs that developers around the world rely on: real-time dashboards, data visualizations, incident notebooks, and the design systems and tools that power them. Our work makes the data we collect easy for users to understand and act on. You’ll join at an ideal time to make a big impact. As the Product Manager - Containers, you will manage the product life-cycle for our Container/Cloud orchestration offerings. Together with your team, you will build solutions that enable our customers to securely migrate to the cloud and leverage the Datadog SaaS portfolio. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Drive the product roadmap for Container focused product offerings Scope, spec, and design new features, working with a cross-functional team of product managers, product designers, engineers, and analysts to achieve product-market fit for new initiatives Work across teams to identify market opportunities Independently research the market and competition Who You Are: You have domain knowledge of cloud containers, cloud orchestration (Kubernetes) and large scale distributed systems. You have a proven track record as a product manager, ideally at a SaaS company You have sharp communication skills and the willingness to present your ideas to technical stakeholders and executives alike You have a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience Datadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. As Product Manager for Enterprise Access Control you’ll be working across our product suites to build out the next generation platform for data access control powering Datadog for customers across the spectrum from regulated industries to large enterprises. You’ll work with Product Managers, Designers and Engineers throughout Datadog to design and develop scalable, secure systems and simple user experiences to help customers manage access in their accounts and to also make sure the end-users can navigate the product intuitively. The ideal candidate will have some understanding and experience with delivering Access Control platforms that have multiple moving parts and can build deep empathy with both the access manager customers who need to control access in their accounts, and for the end user who has to navigate the experience of limited access in an account. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Develop a deep understanding of and empathy for engineers who use Datadog in their day to day. Partner with customers who have to ensure limited access in their accounts to understand their concerns and deliver solutions that help them in their roles. Partner with design to create simple interfaces that communicate complex details. Learn from our most sophisticated customers across any type of environment to be seen as an expert in the field. Provide that expertise within the product and by giving talks and expressing leadership in the industry. Work with world-class Product and Engineering teams to develop and evangelize product priorities and roadmaps that inspire our teams’ best work and deliver real value Support and empower the Sales, Account Management, Marketing and Solutions teams to ensure the broadest reach and the best possible customer experience. Contribute to a culture of learning and collaboration across the department and broader organization. Raise the bar in product management. Who You Are: An experienced Product Manager, ideally at a SaaS company with experience in Access Control (e.g. RBAC, ABAC, IAM) You have a strong technical background, Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the willingness to present and defend your ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences You are customer-minded with a high quality standard for the product to be delivered Benefits & Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global Spring Health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. jobTitle: Product Marketing Manager - Cloud Workload Security
jobDescription: Datadog is looking for a collaborative product marketer to join our Cloud Security Product Marketing team to own and drive go-to-marketing initiatives and launches for our Cloud Native Application Protection Platform(CNAPP) offerings. In this role, you will closely work with product management, sales, and advocacy to champion Datadog cloud security solutions. This role will be a great fit for product marketers who can thrive in dynamic environments, are data-driven and eager to jump-in and get things done. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Take a lead role in creating compelling, differentiated messaging and positioning for Datadog’s cloud security products Leverage your cloud proficiency and cybersecurity expertise to create compelling content and assets that help our customer learn and choose Datadog security solutions for securing their cloud infrastructure and workloads Develop assets, training and content that communicates the value proposition of Datadog cloud security to the sales teams and enables them to win in the industry Work with product and marketing operations to measure success of product-led growth programs and feed those learnings into new launches and campaigns Who You Are: 2+ years of product marketing, product management focused roles in B2B tech that demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of product marketing and all of their strategic components Excellent written, verbal and visual communication skills with a passion for storytelling Strong understanding of pipeline generation activities with the ability to work with demand generation teams and plan campaigns Experience and understanding of cloud, DevOps and endpoint security is a plus Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive benefits package New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. jobTitle: Product Marketing Manager - Cloud Workload Security
jobDescription: Datadog is looking for a collaborative product marketer to join our Cloud Security Product Marketing team to own and drive go-to-marketing initiatives and launches for our Cloud Native Application Protection Platform(CNAPP) offerings. In this role, you will closely work with product management, sales, and advocacy to champion Datadog cloud security solutions. This role will be a great fit for product marketers who can thrive in dynamic environments, are data-driven and eager to jump-in and get things done. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Take a lead role in creating compelling, differentiated messaging and positioning for Datadog’s cloud security products Leverage your cloud proficiency and cybersecurity expertise to create compelling content and assets that help our customer learn and choose Datadog security solutions for securing their cloud infrastructure and workloads Develop assets, training and content that communicates the value proposition of Datadog cloud security to the sales teams and enables them to win in the industry Work with product and marketing operations to measure success of product-led growth programs and feed those learnings into new launches and campaigns Who You Are: 2+ years of product marketing, product management focused roles in B2B tech that demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of product marketing and all of their strategic components Excellent written, verbal and visual communication skills with a passion for storytelling Strong understanding of pipeline generation activities with the ability to work with demand generation teams and plan campaigns Experience and understanding of cloud, DevOps and endpoint security is a plus Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive benefits package New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $123,000 to $164,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The Team: We are a fast-moving, analytically driven marketing team. We run thousands of campaigns, drive market & competitive intelligence, support hundreds of events, enable the sales team, research and evangelize ideas that move our industry forward, and more. Product Marketing Managers (PMM) at Datadog are the bridge between the Product, Marketing, and Sales orgs and leading go-to-market efforts with cross-functional teams. The Opportunity: How can you add value as a PMM at Datadog? From go-to-market strategy for new products and features, to creating the content that enables our sales team, you’ll touch on all areas of the business and help move Datadog forward. We give our Product Marketing Managers the opportunity to collaborate, investigate and idealize how we can gear our product strategy to yield the highest results. You Will: Manage successful product launches by formulating and leading the go-to-market strategy of new product segments and features including: positioning, pricing, packaging, messaging, demos, etc. Conduct thorough competitive and market analysis per product segments, resulting in product roadmap guidance and sales consumable battlecards. Collaborate with teams across marketing to identify and drive strategic events and partners to expand Datadog’s presence and augment our lead generation efforts. Teach, create, and optimize internal learning curriculum that enables the sales team. Requirements: A minimum of 2-4 years of professional experience is required Previous experience bringing technical features/functions from concept to revenue generation, preferably in a B2B context Strong writing and presentation skills with the ability to command an audience Bonus points: You have a BS in a STEM field or technical bootcamp experience You have a technical background or understand modern system architecture, cloud computing and DevOps You’re passionate about exploring new technologies You have prior experience in monitoring, using Datadog or a similar product You’ve had professional experience in development, product management, sales engineering or another technical role Why You Should Apply: Generous and competitive benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Hybrid work environment The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $123,000 - $164,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Product Marketing Manager - Datadog Partner Network
jobDescription: The Opportunity Datadog is seeking an experienced and innovative Product Marketing Manager to be a critical member of the rapidly scaling Datadog Partner Network (DPN) team. We are looking for a Product Marketing Manager to drive partner-oriented content and enablement for this quickly growing segment of the business. You’ll help us scale the program and enable our partners to be successful through leading GTM messaging, enablement and acceleration of partner deal cycles. As our first PMM focused on DPN, you’ll get the chance to have lots of autonomy and impact. You’ll play a pivotal role in creating our product marketing strategy for DPN Partners and scaling this marketing function. What You’ll Do: Go-to-Market - Work closely with our Partner Marketing and Partner Sales teams to define value proposition, customer stories and joint messaging to showcase the value of the Datadog Partner Network (DPN) in order to increase enrollment, engagement and conversions Partner Enablement - Work with Partner Sales Managers as well as DPN partners to update and create new enablement content that will help to improve Partner readiness and partner deal win rates Marketplace Enablement - Evangelize Marketplace offerings to our Datadog Global Sales Team by executing on new offering launch materials and enablement Joint Solution Enablement - Work with Gold Tier Partners and Partner Marketing team to define our joint solution messaging, value proposition and customer uses cases to support co-selling and co-marketing Customer-facing materials - create or update the full spectrum of marketing assets including joint solution briefs, website content, blog posts, campaign content, videos, demos and sales presentation to be used by Datadog Partner Sales Team and DPN members. Thought Leadership - Opportunity to represent Datadog at live enablement sessions and presentations to Partner Sales teams to build awareness for Datadog and drive the success of our partner initiatives. What You’ll Bring: 2+ years of Product Marketing, Go-to-Market, Enablement, Partner Marketing or relevant experience preferred Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; as well as strong messaging skills Prior experience focused on channel and partnership ecosystem marketing, preferred but not required Some industry knowledge, preferably in DevOps or Cloud Monitoring space Prior experience working with Managed Service Providers (MSPs), Systems Integrators and resellers, would be a plus Ability to think strategically and execute independently Always willing to roll up your sleeves The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $123,000 - $164,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The Recruiting team at Datadog is responsible for scaling the growth of our company size. Our recruiters are strategic business partners, matchmakers, sellers and marketeers, all wrapped into one. We contribute to the bottom line and have high visibility to leadership teams as we partner with our business leaders on building their teams with top talent within multiple business areas. You will have the opportunity to shape, mold, and impact how fast we grow, the way we’re viewed, and the candidate experience. Join the team behind the product trusted by thousands of companies, from Deloitte to Peloton, as part of Datadog's 2022 internship program. As a Recruiting intern, you'll work alongside (and learn from) the teams who have helped grow Datadog from a 100 person startup to a publicly traded company of 4,000+ people globally. In a community-focused student cohort, you'll receive guidance from recruiters, sourcers, and leaders who are the best in their field, and build relevant experience that you can apply in the real world. You’ll also participate in outings and networking events with your fellow interns, and collaborate on important initiatives that directly impact the company. Interns will also have the opportunity to attend exclusive talks with Datadog leaders who will give advice and share the lessons they’ve learned over the course of their careers. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Learn to source candidates and prospect passive talent to come work at Datadog Build expertise in sourcing, ATS, and CRM tools such as LinkedIn Recruiter, Eightfold and Greenhouse Job shadow Recruiting and cross-functional team members to learn how their day to day impacts the larger organization Receive job training and mentorship that will expand your skill set! Complete a strategic project to improve processes and provide innovative business solutions Cross functionally liaise with stakeholders to complete assignments Who You Are: You are targeting a 2024 full-time start date You are in the process of receiving/have a degree in Business Administration, Human Resources, Entrepreneurship, Marketing, Sales or related field and have an interest in recruiting Able to work in Datadog’s New York or Boston location throughout the internship and after graduation Able to intern for the entirety of the internship from May 30th - Aug 18th, 2023 Excellent organizational, communication and relationship management skills Excellent follow up and customer service skills Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive global and US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated hourly rate for this role at Datadog ranges from $20.00 to $20.00 per hour, and may include additional compensation elements. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan, if eligible. The Team: Our sales team works with a best-of-breed product that solves real problems for our customers. Sellers follow a well-defined methodology that helps them identify the customer's unique needs and clearly convey the value of the Datadog product. Whether you're looking to learn from the best or be the best, the Datadog sales team is dedicated to furthering personal development and team success. The Opportunity: Looking to get into tech sales? No tech experience? That’s okay - we’ll teach you everything you need to know! Kick start your sales career as a member of a fun, hard-working, and self-motivated team. On Datadog’s Sales Development team you will learn everything you need to know about sales amongst the highest achieving sales reps in the tech space. We're scaling our Sales Development team in Boston to help IT and Technology leaders recognize Datadog’s impact in their digital transformation and migration to the cloud. As a Datadog Sales Development Representative (SDR), you will prospect, qualify, and generate opportunities to support the overall growth of the business. You Will: Research and map prospective new accounts for strategic outreach Cold call and email prospective customers Utilize lead generation tools such as LinkedIn Sales Navigator, DiscoverOrg, and Salesforce Partner with Account Executives to generate leads Have specific daily, monthly, quarterly and yearly pipeline metrics to help achieve sales goals Develop, present and implement plans for acquiring new business and traction in your assigned area You Are: Motivated by a career in sales Interested in the tech space A self starter, focused, dynamic, and eager to learn Someone who has excellent written & verbal communication skills Bonus Points: SaaS/cloud experience, Salesforce experience Prior exposure to a CRM tool Experience in sales or the tech space Proven ability to influence others and create a sense of urgency Why You Should Apply: Join one of the fastest growing global SaaS companies in the world, growing at an average of 67% year-over-year High income earning opportunities based on individual performance Sales training in MEDDIC and Command of the Message Continuous career development and pathing opportunities from a dedicated Sales Enablement team Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally for networking in-house New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Best in class workplace benefits including 401(k) match program and a pet adoption stipend Stocked kitchen with snacks, drinks, and catered lunches every week in office Unlimited paid time off At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. Datadog’s Sales Operations team continues to expand as we work to continuously improve and solve business problems on the Sales Ops team. We are looking for an ambitious Sales Revenue Analyst to join us in Boston, MA. As a function within Sales Operations, we are looking for someone to help us support our revenue team in owning global commissions questions and calculations. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Oversee, administer, and improve upon the existing monthly commission process Constantly Evaluate the sales compensation process to scale Provide analytics into the impact of existing incentive based comp plans and provide data backed suggestions on how to improve Oversee the Deal Close process to ensure that sales are executed within the company standards laid out in the compensation plans, including verifying customer payments Maintain a reporting system for sales quotas, compensation plans, and real time attainment, for all sales levels Administer our Compensation plan distribution and collection process. Make data architectural changes as needed to Improve on quality of customer data within existing billing systems and CRM Collaborate cross functionally with Sales, HR, and Finance System Admin for Xactly Compensation tool Partner with key stakeholders to evaluate and design new incentive programs Who You Are: At least 1 year of experience in revenue analyst, compensation analyst or similar role Advanced Microsoft Excel skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Experience with a Monthly Recurring Revenue business model Bonus Points: Experience working with compensation automation tools (Xactly, Callidus, Obero) Experience in a B2B SaaS company Experience with SaaS contracts and deal bookings process. Experience working in Mac OS Experience with Microsoft Excel Macros Experience using Salesforce, Google Sheets, and Netsuite Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.
