As a Senior Business Systems Analyst you will work with business teams across Datadog to improve their processes, integrate their systems and automate workflows. This is a unique role that combines project and stakeholder management with technical hands on work. In addition to using middleware and low/no-code solutions, you will partner with software engineers to deliver fully custom integrations and solutions. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Learn how business systems currently function and how they are used within Datadog Use this knowledge to identify technical and functional gaps and areas for improvement Architect, build, and maintain system integrations and process automations Plan, prioritize, and deliver system enhancements; executing unit, integration and acceptance testing to meet business requirements Create and maintain internal documentation and processes Collaborate with the Security, Governance, Risk & Compliance teams to ensure business systems adhere to Datadog security and compliance standards (eg. GDPR, SOX) Who You Are: Excellent verbal and written communications skills. Ability to communicate technical solutions to various audiences Strong problem solving and technical skills 4+ years as a business system administrator (e.g., Netsuite, Zendesk, Salesforce or Workday) or in a similar role 4+ years leading medium to large sized cross-functional projects from requirements gathering to go-live across Sales, Finance, and HR Prior experience integrating business systems using middleware (e.g., Workato, Mulesoft, Boomi, Zapier) and working with APIs Prior experience making buy vs build decisions Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $144,000 - $184,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. As a Senior Developer Advocate at Datadog, you will be a technical leader and mentor who anchors our team. You will own projects from beginning to end, enabling Datadog's community to solve real world problems. With a focus in OpenTelemetry, you will be a key contributor to Datadog’s open-source efforts and interact with technical folks across the globe. You’ll have the opportunity to create content across a variety of channels, from blog posts, to video recordings, to traveling and speaking at conferences and Datadog events. What You’ll Do: Create content for developers that makes them more effective practitioners of their craft while building trust and credibility for Datadog Find and pursue opportunities for Datadog to partner with and support open-source communities Partner with product engineering teams to build compelling demos and collaborate with our community of open-source contributors to develop new integrations for Datadog Create developer-facing documentation and training materials for Datadog's SDKs and APIs to foster the growth of our developer community Contribute to the product through feedback (bugs or product enhancements suggestions), documentation, or code Identify and pursue opportunities for events, programs, and other community-focused work that establishes trust with developers Builds awareness of Datadog as a technical leader within our spaces we engage Who You Are: Significant experience with OpenTelemetry, whether instrumenting an application, contributing to open-source projects, or producing high-quality content and educating others on the topic (and have publicly available samples) Able to establish credibility with developers, identify pain points and gaps in developer experience, and bring feedback to the product teams 10+ years experience as a software developer, SRE, or other practitioner; including building and maintaining production systems 3+ years of experience as an advocate and / or equivalent experience e.g. skilled at reaching software developers across multiple channels, such as written content, conference talks, leading workshops, live streaming or recording videos, contributing to open source, and participating in community events You're comfortable in large and small settings, and are able to communicate with technical users of all skill levels, from junior developers to CTOs Bonus points if you have experience with tools such as Jaeger, Grafana Tempo, Prometheus, and AWS X-Ray Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. The IT Support team is responsible for the hardware and software that Datadog employees around the world use on a daily basis to successfully do their jobs. As a senior member of this team, you will be supporting thousands of endpoint devices such as macOS, iOS, Windows, and Chrome OS. You will serve as an escalation point for complex technical issues faced by junior team members, and you will be relaying issues and trends you identify to management and work on fixing them. Additionally, you will support software as a service (SaaS) solutions like Google Workspace, Slack, Zoom, Jamf, and more. You will also facilitate the onboarding of new hires, support current employees and make sure the technology in our offices work. What You’ll Do: Handle general ticketing, account management, and problem escalation, and participate in the On-Call rotation to provide support to users who are in need of urgent assistance. Identify trends, be a key contributor to fixing issues, and work on company wide projects impacting all employees Support unified communications needs for Datadog employees in conference rooms and other common areas Create and maintain internal and user facing documentation Participate in hardware/ software deployment as part of onboarding, refresh cycles, and security related projects Conduct new hire IT orientations covering policies, best practices and services used within Datadog Maintain hardware and software inventory & work with other teams to determine best practices and policies for management & replenishment. Assist with the IT build outs of new office spaces Mentor and train new team members Be a technical owner/ SME of one or more systems, and act as a technical lead and resource for your team Be both a “starter”(explore new complex problem areas to deliver prototypes and proofs-of-concept) and a “finisher” (takes projects from "80% done" to "deployed, correct, operable, and maintainable) Who You Are: You enjoy helping people and providing top of the line customer support You have supported Apple devices such as Macbooks and iPads in a large corporate environment You have excellent verbal and written communications skills You are continuously learning and you’re fascinated by the way things work You have experience in providing detailed support under high pressure settings in a corporate environment You want to work in a fast paced, high growth startup environment You’ve used Google Workspace and other common SaaS applications such as Slack, Zoom, Trello, RingCentral and Jamf to administer & manage user accounts You have experience managing medium to large IT related projects Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. We are Datadog's in-house product experts. The technical solutions team enables Datadog's worldwide growth by educating potential clients and ensuring that existing customers are happy and successful. We share our technical and product expertise with customers through demos, presentations, technical evaluations, and ongoing support. You’ll be joining a team and company immersed in a startup-like environment where you will be challenged, but also will immediately witness your contributions to Datadog. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Engage with customers via multiple channels (ticketing system, live chat, and screensharing tools) to identify and resolve technical support requests while continuing to educate our clients on the use of the platform Reproduce technical issues and dive into Datadog’s 400+ integrations Handle urgent escalation cases that may result in customer-facing troubleshooting calls, and internal or external incident management Autonomously troubleshoot complex and/or high-priority customer issues without guidance Become a subject matter expert in many Datadog product areas Drive product conversations based on needs and problems learned during client interactions Lead high-complexity demos regarding specific and advanced use cases Provide mentorship to junior members of the team and serve as their escalation partner Work from a Datadog office 3 - 5 days per week Who You Are: A candidate with previous experience supporting clients in the public sector Experienced in multi-channel technical support at a SaaS company (5+ years of related experience) Experienced with APIs, REST calls and an understanding of Network terminologies Familiar with one or more Cloud technologies An exceptional written and verbal communicator, with experience communicating complex technical issues to both technical and non-technical audiences A strong mentor to your technical peers A critical thinker who defaults to a client-centric approach Self-motivated, detail-attentive, and able to continuously learn A tinkerer with programming experience and a mid to advance knowledge of Linux Able to work an on-call rotating schedule that requires weekend availability Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. To conform to U.S. export control regulations, candidates should be eligible for any required authorizations from the U.S. Government. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The Team: We are a fast-moving, analytically driven B2B marketing team. We show innovative companies how they can improve their applications and get to market faster. We do hundreds of events, thousands of marketing campaigns, research and evangelize ideas that move our industry forward, and more. The Opportunity: Datadog is looking for a tenured Field Marketing Manager to design and build field marketing programs for our Western Region. This role will be a key player in fostering the growth of Datadog’s regional marketing practice. Other foreign languages are a plus Willing to travel up to 50% Why You Should Apply: Generous and competitive global and US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $118,000 - $157,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. About Datadog: We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—providing always-on alerting, metrics visualization, logs, and application tracing for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way. The opportunity: Datadog is building a world-class APM product that traces requests as they flow across complex systems. We are looking for an expert Node.js developer who can help push our Javascript tracing tools to the next level. Come and join us to build amazing open-source software. You will: Write open-source code that instruments thousands of Node applications around the world Drive our open-source Node projects and engage with the community to find and fix the most important challenges Join a great team building software the right way Requirements: You’re a master Node programmer. You are a great community ambassador and can drive hard technical conversations towards a good solution You want to work in a fast, high growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent experience Bonus points: You have significant experience with Python, Go, Javascript, Ruby or PHP You have experience with code telemetry and introspection The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $187,000 - $240,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate’s skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. This role will lead a global team of recruiters, drive full cycle recruiting across the America and EMEA for roles within our Tech Solutions business units, and act as an advisor and trusted resource to hiring managers and the interview team. In this role, you will operate as a coach in hiring the best talent plus leading a team towards growth goals. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Be responsible for staffing, forecasting hiring targets, goal setting, training, and leading your team to achieve projected team recruiting goals annually Effectively manage managers; this role will have 4 Team Leads, each with multiple direct reports Coach team to prioritize creating diverse talent pipelines, while fostering high touch relationships with active and passive candidates Develop ideas to pivot messaging, job descriptions, or any external facing content/events to help impact our ability to acquire talent Stay on top of the latest recruiting strategies and market movements, while facilitating training sessions with recruiters and leaders as it pertains to sourcing, interviewing, profile identification, process workflow, etc. Use funnel metrics which impact the business to drive actions and change management to address resource and operational challenges, while ensuring the recruiting process is fast, efficient, and human at all stages Who You Are: Experienced in 9+ years of full-lifecycle recruiting, including experience hiring at varying levels across technology and/or engineering business functions Passionate about coaching others with 3+ years of direct management experience, having managed a team of 10+ recruiters, and preferably having managed managers Superior at selling value proposition, negotiating and closing great candidates Skilled at operating with a sense of urgency in all stages of the recruiting cycle Able to successfully navigate an ever-changing process Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The IT Operations Office Technology team is responsible for the buildout, maintenance and improvement of our offices around the globe. Every Datadog office puts the employee experience first to create a space for Datadog employees to do their best work. We ensure the technology in our offices is second to none. As a member of the IT Office Technology team, you’ll help Datadog build and maintain best-in-class offices and all the technology that keeps them running and providing a high quality employee experience. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Serve as a subject matter expert on WiFi and the networking infrastructure in our offices Work closely with our vendors on procurement, design and ongoing project management for office builds and upgrades Design and drive efficiencies in the process and technology for collaborative A/V for different types of spaces, including large meeting spaces, traditional meeting rooms and huddle rooms Collaborate on various initiatives with Office Operations and other employee-focused teams Able to design and drive efficiencies in the process and technology in the A/V, Networking and overall build process within office technology Serve as a point of escalation for the Enterprise IT organization on Office Technology related issues Who You Are You are extremely technical Excellent verbal and written communications skills Passionate about delivering high quality, low-complexity collaboration experiences at scale Experienced in designing and maintaining Meraki and Meraki WiFi networks Comfortable running and troubleshooting large all-hands spaces and presentations Comfortable with frequent business travel Datadog values people from all walks of life. We’re looking for a Senior Product Designer with a passion for building tools that help developers build better software. You’ll be working as a part of the APM Design Team, which is responsible for a suite of tools that help developers optimize and troubleshoot their application performance. For this role specifically you will focus on our CI/CD Visibility tools that help enhance the development experience before code hits production so engineers can ship more confidently. That includes helping engineers understand test coverage, performance, and results, along with their pipeline behavior and overall performance. You’ll not only own your design work, you’ll help other designers understand your product area to shape a holistic view of development workflows to make software optimization and troubleshooting simpler and faster. You’ll also act as a leader within the product design team, collaborating with other designers to make their work and the whole team better. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Work with product managers, engineers, and data scientists to understand how our customers use Datadog and what they need to succeed See your design work through from start to finish: turn insights from user research into ideas, sketch and prototype to bring them to life, and ship products and features that make Datadog better Be the expert in your product area, mentoring designers on the team to do their best work Communicate both your design work and the support for your design decisions across the company Work closely with engineering teams to understand how your designs will be built Who You Are: You have 5+ years of experience in digital product design Your portfolio includes a proven track record of shipping design work in complex enterprise-grade web applications You have experience working with cross-functional teams to help iteratively improve software You are an excellent visual and written communicator, able to clearly communicate your design work and support your design decisions You have experience or an interest in the developer tool space. These are the users and use cases you will be focusing on the most. You understand systems thinking and component-based design patterns Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. About Datadog: We're on a mission to build the best platform in the world for engineers to understand and scale their systems, applications, and teams. We operate at high scale—trillions of data points per day—allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally for tens of thousands of companies. Our engineering culture values pragmatism, honesty, and simplicity to solve hard problems the right way. The Team: The Product Design team works on embedded product teams, collaborating closely with PMs and engineers on major product area. Product Design is its own department, independent from engineering or product management. We’re full-stack designers, owning all aspects of our work from research, prototyping, polish, and engineering hand-off. We work closely together, collaborating with our DesignOps team to develop our design system and tooling. The Opportunity: We’re looking for a Senior Product Designer with a passion for building technical tools and scalable design systems. Our designers build the UI that developers around the world rely on: real-time dashboards, data visualizations, data-driven notebooks, core site functionality, and the design systems and tools that power it. Their work makes the data we collect easy for users to understand and act on. You’ll act as a leader within the product design team, collaborating with other designers to make their work and the whole team better. You’ll not only own the success or failure of your design work, you’ll help other designers communicate their ideas and the support for their design decisions across the company. You’ll join at an ideal time to make a big impact. We are expanding globally, designing and building multiple new products, and rolling out DesignOps to speed up and scale design. You’ll be involved in every step of the process—defining product, collaborating with PMs and engineering leads, and researching, prototyping and scaling design with new systems. You Will: Work with product managers, engineers, and data scientists to understand how our customers use Datadog and what they need to succeed See your design work through from start to finish: turn insights from user research into ideas, sketch and prototype to bring them to life, and ship products and features that make Datadog better Be the expert in your product area, mentoring designers on the team to do their best work Communicate both your design work and the support for your design decisions across the company Work closely with engineering teams to understand how your designs will be built You Are: You have 5+ years of experience in digital product design Your portfolio includes a proven track record of shipping interaction design work in web applications You are an excellent visual and written communicator, able to clearly communicate your design work and the support for your design decisions You have experience with advanced prototyping tools (e.g. Principle, Framer, Sketch, Figma, InVision) You understand systems thinking and component-based design patterns You give and receive feedback well, supporting and improving the work of your colleagues as well as your own You want to work in a rapidly changing, high-growth startup environment Bonus Points: You understand cloud infrastructure and have experience with platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure You have worked on technical products and data visualizations You have built SaaS, enterprise software, or developer tools You have experience with Figma and Framer You can write HTML, CSS, and React/JavaScript About Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. jobTitle: Senior Product Manager - Application Security (Threat Detection)
jobDescription: The Cloud Security Platform helps organizations seamlessly secure their cloud-native applications, workloads, and infrastructures, all from the same platform their engineering teams use every day. The Application Security team is the newest product of the Cloud Security Platform. Application Security - Threat Detection and Efficacy is a critical strategic pillar for the Datadog Application Security monitoring platform and we are looking for an experienced product management leader to drive the key capabilities and growth in coordination with other key pillars of the platform. Together with your team, you will build solutions that drive efficacy of the product to detect threats, correlate observability information, increase signal to noise ratio and ultimately help customers remediate and stop attacks. This is a key role that requires a background in SaaS and security product management background, domain expertise in application security or adjacent domains (Incident Response and Forensics, Cloud Native security, Web Application Firewalls (WAF), API Security And Bot Detection, etc.), and a deeper understanding of the security challenges associated with modern (DevOps/Cloud) application development. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Drive the strategy and roadmap for Datadog ASM Threat Detection and Security Efficacy, including the product vision, strategy, and execution for the service across the portfolio. Drive and own the product requirements while working closely with key stakeholders including, customers, sales, engineering, threat researchers, designers, and other product management leaders to assure delivery of an integrated experience Partner with our product leaders across Datadog Security and other portfolios, APM, and Logs to derive security signals from observability data Establish clear metrics and KPIs to continuously evaluate portfolio performance and feature usability with a direct feedback loop into the product roadmap Develop a deep understanding of the market landscape and identify key areas of competitive differentiation and market disruption Work closely with Executives, Marketing, Sales, PR, Design, and Support teams to successfully bring to the market new application security features Who You Are: At least 5-7 years of experience in a customer-facing role in the security industry Product Management experience in addition to experience in Engineering, Security Operations or Threat research domains. Strong sense of ownership: will own and measure outcomes along with sales, technical solutions, products, etc. Experience in driving SaaS products ideally in observability or application security space with a good understanding of the Security and DevOps buyer personas Ideally experience in direct or adjacent markets and domains: Application Observability, Web Application Firewall, Incident Response, and Forensics, Application Security Testing, and Application firewalls, Cloud native security. Demonstrated ability to distill and present research findings, market analysis, and product requirements for both technical and non-technical audiences.Strong affinity for customer empathy, a keen eye for design and relationship building Demonstrated robust, structured, and data-driven problem-solving and prioritization skills, using strong verbal and written communications. Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $187,000 - $240,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Senior Product Manager - CI/CD Pipeline Visibility
jobDescription: The CI/CD Observability team is expanding Datadog’s capabilities to help software engineering teams do more, faster. We do this by providing them with unique insights during the software development lifecycle. By instrumenting test and benchmark frameworks, CI/CD pipelines and source code management tools, we enable users to track, identify and debug failures and performance regressions on CI/CD, as well as their applications, before they reach production. As a Senior Product Manager in the CI/CD Observability team, you will work with a team of engineers, designers, marketers, and salesfolk, to grow and innovate on Datadog’s CI/CD Visibility product suite. You will own and drive the product roadmap and vision for our Pipeline Visibility product – delivering new features and capabilities through close collaboration with our customers and integrations with our partners. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What you’ll do: Be responsible for driving your product roadmap and vision, and delivering new features, based on customer feedback, business objectives, research, and market trends Be accountable for business goals related to product ownership such as revenue, adoption, usage, and margin Partner with customers and understand our users (software developers, build, platform, and release engineers) deeply; design solutions they find intuitive and delightful Build and deliver integrations with key business partners in the CI/CD ecosystem Work with a broad range of internal cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing and customer success teams, to define GTM strategy and optimize revenue Who you are: You have a proven track record as a senior technical product manager independently defining strategy and owning execution of a development-centric product You have experience in defining and delivering new products, expertly balancing customer and business objectives You have deep understanding of the broader architecture and major technical considerations for your products, and a passion for learning about new technologies You have strong customer empathy and the ability to communicate effectively on technical topics with nuance for different audiences, including executives You have the ability to influence and make org-level decisions on product development and go-to-market strategy Bonus Points: You have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience You have previous experience with developer tools, CI/CD, software testing, cloud monitoring, or observability. You’ve worked with modern cloud environments and are familiar with CI/CD products and tooling You have hands-on coding/software development experience Datadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. Benefits & Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global Spring Health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $187,000 - $240,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Senior Product Manager - CI/CD Pipeline Visibility
jobDescription: The CI/CD Observability team is expanding Datadog’s capabilities to help software engineering teams do more, faster. We do this by providing them with unique insights during the software development lifecycle. By instrumenting test and benchmark frameworks, CI/CD pipelines and source code management tools, we enable users to track, identify and debug failures and performance regressions on CI/CD, as well as their applications, before they reach production. As a Senior Product Manager in the CI/CD Observability team, you will work with a team of engineers, designers, marketers, and salesfolk, to grow and innovate on Datadog’s CI/CD Visibility product suite. You will own and drive the product roadmap and vision for our Pipeline Visibility product – delivering new features and capabilities through close collaboration with our customers and integrations with our partners. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What you’ll do: Be responsible for driving your product roadmap and vision, and delivering new features, based on customer feedback, business objectives, research, and market trends Be accountable for business goals related to product ownership such as revenue, adoption, usage, and margin Partner with customers and understand our users (software developers, build, platform, and release engineers) deeply; design solutions they find intuitive and delightful Build and deliver integrations with key business partners in the CI/CD ecosystem Work with a broad range of internal cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing and customer success teams, to define GTM strategy and optimize revenue Who you are: You have a proven track record as a senior technical product manager independently defining strategy and owning execution of a development-centric product You have experience in defining and delivering new products, expertly balancing customer and business objectives You have deep understanding of the broader architecture and major technical considerations for your products, and a passion for learning about new technologies You have strong customer empathy and the ability to communicate effectively on technical topics with nuance for different audiences, including executives You have the ability to influence and make org-level decisions on product development and go-to-market strategy Bonus Points: You have a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience You have previous experience with developer tools, CI/CD, software testing, cloud monitoring, or observability. You’ve worked with modern cloud environments and are familiar with CI/CD products and tooling You have hands-on coding/software development experience Datadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. Benefits & Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global Spring Health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $187,000 - $240,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Senior Product Manager - Cloud Security Posture Management (Kubernetes)
jobDescription: Cloud Security Posture Management (CSPM) is the foundational capability for securing Cloud Native Apps, and the basis for bridging the gap between developers and security teams. This is a senior role that drives CSPM to add container-specific, specifically Kubernetes-specific requirements into the product. This senior role requires you to bring your knowledge of Kubernetes and security into a foundational product that thousands of customers already use. This role will require working with head of security organizations, Kubernetes experts and developers to clarify, prioritize and execute on capabilities that will drive adoption in Kubernetes environments. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Determine Kubernetes security gaps and evaluate how CSPM can help address these in the product Coordinate and coral teams to build the right set of rules that allow customers to easily and confidently consume this content through our existing CSPM product. Work in lock-step with the development teams to help build out Kubernetes specific capabilities in CSPM. Wear many hats, and build out the alliances that our enterprise security customers will ask or to adopt the new capability Build out and drive the GTM actions for taking Kubernetes based Cloud Security Platform to market. Align relevant stakeholders across the company to execute on strategy and drive business outcomes. Contribute to propagating a customer-centric culture across the Product Engineering organization & provide customer/market feedback to other product managers to adjust roadmaps Who You Are: At least 5 years of experience in a security-focussed product management role in the industry Experience with Kubernetes as a developer or operator for 2+years. Strong sense of ownership: will own and measure outcomes along with sales, technical solutions, product, etc. Thinking from first principles equally comfortable with the big picture and with the details Strong verbal and written communicator. Experience presenting to senior stakeholders Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $187,000 - $240,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Senior Product Manager - Cloud Security Products (Detection PM)
jobDescription: Datadog’s Cloud Security Platform provides customers with a unified view of the security posture of infrastructure to enable development and security teams to proactively discover misconfigurations, detect threats and take remediation actions all with one, integrated product. Datadog’s security products are engines that rely heavily on the content that is produced by security researchers and other security experts in the company. This highly visible leadership role will allow you to use your security domain expertise to define and prioritize content of what is built by these experts and what each of Datadog’s security products use. It will require working with our customer’s CISO and their groups to clarify, prioritize and execute on the detections that will move the needle for the customer, and our business. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Evaluate what detection rules would need to get prioritized and built to meet the needs of our customers. Coordinate and coral teams to build the right set of rules that allow customers to easily and confidently consume this content through some of our existing products. Wear many hats, and build out the alliances that our enterprise security customers will ask or to adopt the new product Align relevant stakeholders across the company to execute on strategy and drive business outcomes. Contribute to propagating a customer-centric culture across the Product Engineering organization & provide customer/market feedback to other product managers to adjust roadmaps Who You Are: At least 5 years of experience in an security-focussed product management role in the industry (Product, Customer Success, Sales Engineering, Sales) Strong sense of ownership: will own and measure outcomes along with sales, technical solutions, product, etc. Thinking from first principles equally comfortable with the big picture and with the details Strong verbal and written communicator. Experience presenting to senior stakeholders Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. jobTitle: Senior Product Manager - CNAPP Vulnerability Management
jobDescription: As the founding Product Manager for the Vulnerability Management team, you use observability context and vulnerability data together, helping customers understand what the actual risk that vulnerabilities present to their infrastructure and why. You will own the vulnerability management capabilities for hosts and containers, from the collection of SBOMs to the analysis of vulnerability data, and resource relationships to assess the actual risk to customers’ environments at runtime. You will collaborate with engineering, data science, and other product managers across the Datadog platform to create a new product and bring vulnerability management to our customers. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Drive the product roadmap and execution for CNAPP Vulnerability Management Leverage observability context to create a unique vulnerability management offering driving real risk reduction for customers Work with other product managers to integrate vulnerability insights into products across the Datadog platform Grow the Vulnerability Management team to support the needs of our customers Work closely with Executives, Marketing, Sales, PR, Design and Support teams to successfully ship new security features. Engage with cloud-native SRE and security engineering teams to identify new market opportunities and extract valuable product feedback Conduct market and competitive research Who You Are: You have a proven track record as a product manager in the Cloud Security industry You understand the makeup of VM and Container Images You have a strong technical background and enjoy learning new technologies You have sharp communication skills and the willingness to present your ideas to technical stakeholders and executives alike You have experience creating products/features using large data-sets and advanced analytics techniques Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. jobDescription: As a Product Manager for the Cloud Workload Security team, you will own detection and active defense capabilities for Workload Security, bringing bleeding edge techniques together with security and observability data to make Cloud Workload Security the most powerful and comprehensive threat detection and response product for production infrastructure. As a Senior Product Manager for Apps, you will work with a team of product managers and engineers to build a product that our customers use to develop their own internal apps. These apps could range from management consoles for internal services, to enterprise customisation for the Datadog UI, to partner-developed features, to plenty of exciting emergent behaviour based on this powerful new development platform. With Datadog Apps, engineers will rapidly prototype and deploy their own apps without having to be frontend experts, and do so with common design patterns that avoid user-error. These are fully managed apps so individuals can get to production quickly, without provisioning or maintaining new cloud resources. This is just the start though – ultimately, engineers at enterprise businesses spend about half their time writing internal software, and secular trends in engineering budgets are making it crucial to buy tools to support these developers. Datadog is well positioned to provide these tools, and your challenge will be to ship something that will be able to grow and address what we think is an enormous revenue opportunity. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Develop a deep understanding of and empathy for engineers who write their own tools Learn from our most sophisticated customers across any type of environment to be seen as an expert in the field. Provide that expertise within the product and by giving talks and expressing leadership in the industry. Work with Product and Engineering teams to develop and evangelise product priorities and roadmaps that inspire our teams’ best work and deliver real value Support and empower the Sales, Account Management, Marketing and Solutions teams to ensure the broadest reach and the best possible customer experience Contribute to a culture of learning and collaboration across the department and broader organisation Raise the bar in product management Who You Are: An experienced Product Manager, ideally at a SaaS company You have a strong technical background and/or sense of the day in the life of an engineer who holds a pager. You have Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the willingness to present and defend your ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences You are customer-minded with a high quality standard for the product to be delivered Datadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. jobTitle: Senior Product Manager - Google Cloud Integrations
jobDescription: As the Product Manager, Google Cloud Integrations, you’ll own the vision, roadmap, and execution for our integrations with Google Cloud. You’ll work closely with a diverse set of customers to understand how they manage their Google cloud environments and what services they’re using. You’ll work with product teams across Datadog and Google Cloud to identify opportunities to improve our existing integrations and create new ones, and you’ll partner with engineers, designers, and go-to market teams to drive adoption across thousands of customers. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Gather insights from customers, partner teams at Google, analysts, and internal data to become an expert on how customers are adopting Google Cloud Define the vision, strategy, and product roadmap for what integrations to build, how to improve the set up and management experience, and how to make our integrations immediately valuable to customers Build relationships with other Datadog product teams and identify opportunities to help them by ingesting and enriching new data sources Partner with Marketing and other GTM teams (within both Datadog and Google) to generate awareness and drive adoption of Datadog’s solutions Who You Are: You have 3+ years of experience in B2B SaaS Product Management (ideally working on integrations or a developer-focused product) You possess a deep understanding (and interest) in software development and emerging technologies You have hands on experience using multiple services from one or more of the major cloud providers (AWS, Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud) You have sharp communication skills and the willingness to present your ideas to technical stakeholders and executives alike You have a Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Technology, or equivalent experience Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. The Opportunity: Given the resilience of cloud technologies and importance placed today in digital operations and agility, Datadog continues to innovate and is well positioned for the long term. Partnering closely with our customers and internal teams of engineers, designers, marketers, and salesfolk, you will be part of defining the future of a rapidly growing business. You Will: Be responsible for driving your product roadmap and vision, and delivering the MVP for new products, based on customer feedback, business objectives, research, and market trends Be accountable for business goals related to product ownership such as revenue, adoption, usage and margin Partner with customers and understand our users (software developers, ops engineers) deeply; design solutions they find intuitive and delightful Work with a broad range of internal cross-functional teams, including sales, marketing and customer success teams, to define GTM strategy and optimize revenue Participate in interviewing, hiring and onboarding product managers, as needed to grow talented and diverse teams You may also lead a small team of product managers, overseeing their day-to-day, formally supporting their growth and development, and fostering an environment that encourages positive engagement and performance You Are: A proven track record as a senior technical product manager independently defining strategy and owning execution of a IaaS/SaaS cloud based product Experience in defining and delivering new products, expertly balancing customer and business objectives Deep understanding of the broader architecture and major technical considerations for your products within the cloud infrastructure and DevOps domain, and a passion for learning about new technologies Strong customer empathy and the ability to communicate effectively on topics within DevOps with nuance for different audiences, including executives The ability to influence and make org-level decisions on product development and go-to-market strategy Bonus Points: A Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience Previous experience in cloud monitoring/observability You’ve worked with modern cloud environments that utilize kubernetes, containers, serverless, and more Hands-on coding/software development experience Why You Should Apply: Generous and competitive global and US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture For more information on our different teams and opportunities, please visit our Blog! The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $130,000 - $300,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Senior Product Manager - Revenue Engineering Platform
jobDescription: The Revenue Engineering team is at the core of monetization and go-to-market at Datadog, and is responsible for metering and aggregating product usage, SaaS subscription modeling and lifecycle, and surfacing usage and cost insights for all of our customers and product offerings. As a Product Manager on the Revenue Engineering platform team, you will be leading the metering and billing engineering teams to make this critical platform easier to onboard new products, as well as expand its capabilities to address the most advanced requirements of Datadog’s newer products. You’ll join at an ideal time to make a big impact as the platform is seeing tremendous growth and launching new initiatives, such as standalone metering. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Collaborate with all Product and Engineering teams at Datadog to understand their metering needs and address them in a single technical platform Work with the Revenue Engineering team to develop and evangelize platform priorities and roadmap that inspire our teams’ best work and deliver real value Have exec-level conversations internally and externally, balancing company-wide business priorities and initiatives while advocating for the technical constraints at play Help others remove roadblocks towards meeting team goal Contribute to a culture of learning and collaboration across the department and broader organization and act as a leader in the Product organization Who You Are: An experienced Product Manager with a proven track record managing complex data platforms, ideally at a SaaS company and/or on a data engineering team You have a strong technical background and understand the basics of metering and analytics You have Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience You have a passion for fast-paced, high-growth environment scaling existing products and evangelizing a technical platform You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the willingness to present and defend your ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences Datadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. Benefits & Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global Spring Health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $187,000 - $240,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. As the Senior Product Manager for Service Management, you will own and work on products that our customers use to build real-time visualization of their cloud infrastructures, enabling them to generate dynamic architecture models that detail configurations, cost, and inter-service interactions. A well-designed cloud architecture is essential to ensure that the underlying infrastructure stays operational, within budget, and compliant over time. We are looking for a passionate product manager who will indulge their curiosity, dive into conversations with the most sophisticated tech shops in the world, deeply understand their visualization needs, and ship a product that analyzes service relationships, detects the new infrastructure and updates your diagrams accordingly. This product neatly complements our observability and monitoring products and you will be able to take advantage of existing sales channels. Datadog product managers are customer-obsessed, and you will also find emergent behavior that will guide the development of cloud architecture visualization into new markets. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Develop a deep understanding of the diagramming needs of dev, ops, and security engineers to help them with cloud migrations, container adoptions, and other common architectural changes. Prioritize for overall commercial growth of Datadog cloud architecture diagramming tools and improve products for our customers to use data to inform responsive, robust, and secure changes to production. Incorporate common patterns you learn in customer conversations into instructive articles and talks to benefit the community. Work with world-class Product and Engineering teams to develop and evangelize product priorities and roadmaps that inspire our teams’ best work and deliver real value Support and empower the Sales, Account Management, Marketing and Solutions teams to ensure the broadest reach and the best possible customer experience Contribute to a culture of learning and collaboration across the department and broader organization Raise the bar in product management Who You Are: An experienced Product Manager, ideally at a SaaS company You have a strong technical background and/or sense of the day in the life of an engineer shipping, maintaining, or securing a distributed cloud application. You have Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering or equivalent experience You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and the willingness to present and defend your ideas to both technical and non-technical audiences You are customer-minded with a high quality standard for the product to be delivered Datadog values people from all walks of life. We know not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That’s okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your experience, we encourage you to apply. Benefits & Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intra-departmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global Spring Health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. jobTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager - CI Visibility
jobDescription: The Team: We are a fast-moving, analytically driven marketing team. We run thousands of campaigns, drive market & competitive intelligence, support hundreds of events, enable the sales team, research and evangelize ideas that move our industry forward, and more. Product Marketing Managers (PMM) at Datadog are the bridge between the Product, Marketing, and Sales orgs and leading go-to-market efforts with cross-functional teams. The Opportunity: Are you looking for a place where you can not just grow your product marketing career, but be able to put your own stamp on what Datadog product marketing does? From go-to-market strategy for new products and features to creating the content that enables our sales and partner teams, you’ll touch on all areas of the business and help scale Datadog even further as a mini CMO of one of our fastest growing products. We give our Product Marketing Managers the opportunity to collaborate, investigate, and idealize how we can gear our product strategy to yield the highest results. This is a full-time hybrid role in our NYC office. You Will: Manage successful product launches by formulating and leading the go-to-market strategy of new product segments and features including: messaging, positioning, pricing, packaging, demos, etc. Collaborate with teams across Marketing, Product and Sales to identify and drive strategic campaigns, events, partnerships, and training to expand Datadog’s presence and augment our lead generation efforts. Conduct thorough competitive and market analysis per product segments, resulting in product roadmap guidance and sales consumable battlecards. Teach, create, and optimize internal learning curriculum that enables the sales and customer success teams. Requirements: A minimum of 2-4 years of professional experience is required Previous experience bringing technical features/functions from concept to revenue generation, preferably in a B2B context Strong writing and presentation skills with the ability to command an audience Bonus points: You have prior experience in launching and promoting products in untapped markets You have coding / QA experience or a good understanding of a software developer’s day to day You have a BS in computer science or a related field You’re passionate about exploring new technologies Why You Should Apply: Generous and competitive benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $154,000 - $205,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. jobTitle: Senior Product Marketing Manager - Infrastructure Monitoring, Network and Devices
jobDescription: About Us: Datadog is the monitoring and security platform for cloud applications. Our SaaS product is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries to enable digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stack, allowing for seamless collaboration and problem-solving among Dev, Ops and Security teams globally. Given the resilience of cloud technologies and importance placed today in digital operations and agility, Datadog continues to innovate and is well positioned for the long term. The Team: Product Marketing is a key part of bringing Datadog’s observability products to market. Working across teams, we represent the voice of the customer and craft positioning, messaging, and go-to-market strategies that drive successful growth of our expanding portfolio of products. The Opportunity: As a Product Marketing Manager for our Network Performance Monitoring and Network Device Monitoring products, you’ll position and launch new capabilities, increase market presence, and build a strategic narrative targeted at multiple personas; you will then put your story and messaging to work in many creative ways available to you across campaigns, enablement, events, and sales plays. In this role, you’ll touch on all areas of the business and help scale Datadog even further as a mini CMO of your product. We empower our Product Marketing Managers to work cross-functionally and create a unique path to commercial success of the areas they own. This is a full-time hybrid role in our NYC office. You Will: Manage successful product launches by formulating and leading the go-to-market strategy of new product segments and features including: messaging, positioning, pricing, packaging, demos, etc. Collaborate with teams across Marketing, Product and Sales to identify and drive strategic campaigns, events, partnerships, and training to expand Datadog’s presence and augment our lead generation efforts. Conduct thorough competitive and market analysis per product segments, resulting in product roadmap guidance and sales consumable battlecards. Teach, create, and optimize internal learning curriculum that enables the sales and customer success teams. Requirements: A minimum of 2-4 years of professional experience is required Previous experience bringing technical features/functions from concept to revenue generation, preferably in Infrastructure, Networking, and Cloud technology space Strong writing and presentation skills with the ability to command an audience Bonus points: You have prior experience in launching and promoting products in untapped markets You have network engineering experience or an ability to understand an engineer’s day to day You have a BS in computer science or a related field You’re passionate about exploring new technologies Why You Should Apply: Generous and competitive benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $154,000 - $205,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. About Datadog: Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers’ entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Datadog’s Sales Operations team is seeking an innovative and passionate Salesforce expert, who will impact a rapidly growing environment and its connected third-party systems. This individual will proactively engage and support our internal customer needs and ensure we are delivering high quality solutions. They manage all CRM configuration, maintain existing features/products for the business, and partner with stakeholders to design and implement new global initiatives, and drive global quality improvement processes. What You’ll Do: Combine Salesforce product expertise with business acumen and technical skill Partner with multi-functional teams: Sales, Channel and Alliances, Marketing, Sales Enablement, Product, Engineering, and Finance to streamline and optimize the processes related to Lead-to-Opportunity and Quote-to-Cash Lead and manage the design, configuration, and deployment of our medium complexity CRM and other modules to support sales and support automation Perform Salesforce administrator functions including maintenance/updates, system backups, security, roles, profiles, sharing rules, workflows and groups Coordinate user acceptance testing (UAT) to ensure requirements are met. This includes tracking issues through to resolution and securing end user acceptance sign-off Ensure consistency across processes and systems that are being followed by the entire business through training, lunch and learn sessions, etc. Write design documentation and training materials supporting business needs Monitor user adoption rates and respond as needed (e.g., additional training sessions, well-organized & informative presentations) Mentor other members of the team to maximize the team’s overall productivity and effectiveness Who You Are: BA/BS/Masters in Business, Engineering, or other quantitative field Minimum 4+ years of direct experience working with Salesforce administration Keep up to date with Salesforce releases, features and best practices. Make recommendations to management regarding implementation as appropriate Knowledge of ETL integrations with connected databases Experience with Quote to Cash and Channel and Alliances processes in a SaaS & recurring revenue company Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities Salesforce Certified Administrator or Salesforce Consultant or any other relevant certification Ability to mentor and coach other Salesforce admins. Bonus Points: Experience migrating Salesforce Classic to Lightning UI Comfortable working in a SOX and Change Management focused environment Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I or Salesforce Advanced Administrator or CPQ Specialist or Salesforce Consultant or any other relevant certification Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global Spring Health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Giving programs Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $95,000 - $140,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan.
