Datadog is looking for a Talent Development Manager to develop, implement, manage, facilitate, and enhance learning programs that will advance the company’s performance and strengthen our culture. This role is critical to the expansion of organization-wide learning initiatives as we rapidly scale. You will have the opportunity to make a big impact at Datadog by enabling our People team to deliver more frequent and robust learning globally. This cross-functional role will involve partnering with stakeholders across the business and within the People team to ensure we are delivering and optimizing quality talent development programs. You will help unlock the potential of current and future employees by designing and executing accessible, high-impact, and enjoyable learning experiences. The successful candidate will be able to hit the ground running by confidently launching and managing a global employee mentorship program, robust learning communities, and an expansive employee-to-employee development initiative. Additionally, they will begin to suggest optimizations to current programming and design improvements and new material where applicable. They will quickly begin to build relationships with stakeholders and drive cross-functional projects through completion to achieve business goals. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do Design and deliver innovative, high-quality learning experiences that are impactful and valued by employees across various departments and geographies. Additionally, align global learning programs with talent management and performance initiatives Launch and manage a new global mentorship program to help Datadogs navigate their careers and maximize their potential Develop, manage, and scale various employee-led learning initiatives, devising a strategy and structure to drive strong impact Facilitate workshops (e.g., mentor training) that drive meaningful behavior change as well as utilize technology in creative ways to enhance outcomes and promote scalability Collaborate with SMEs across the business to help them develop high-quality training programs, including facilitator-led workshops and eLearning content Work with Talent Development team members to measure the success of learning programs through thoughtful data collection and analysis Who You Are: At least 8 years of professional experience in L&D, Talent Development, or a related field Proven track record of building, launching, and managing global talent programs like mentorship, peer learning exchange, or similar Ability to create and execute on strategic plans to ensure the ongoing success of our learning programs in a constantly evolving landscape Demonstrated ability to design clear and aesthetically engaging learning content and resources, including digital tools Exceptional organization and project management skills plus experience driving results for projects with multiple contributors and stakeholders Strong facilitation skills that are effective in both in-person and virtual formats Ability to analyze learning and development programs and provide end-to-end strategic recommendations Ability to work from our New York City office at least 3 days per week Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Distributed Systems engineers at Datadog design, implement and run in production the foundational platforms powering our applications. Your data pipelines will ingest, store, analyze and query in real-time billions of events per second from companies all over the globe. The platforms are optimized for durability, high availability, low latency, internet-scale footprint and operability. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Build fault-tolerant, horizontally scalable solutions running in multi-tenant environments Write in Go, Java Rust or C++, amongst other languages Use Kafka, Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch and other open-source components Own meaningful parts of our service, have an impact, grow with the company Who You Are: You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent experience You have significant backend programming experience in one or more languages (Go, Java, Rust, C++) You have been exposed to working on problems (high durability / low latency /…) You can get down to the low-level when needed You care about simple designs and performance You want to work in a fast, high-growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Distributed Systems engineers at Datadog design, implement and run in production the foundational platforms powering our applications. Your data pipelines will ingest, store, analyze and query in real-time billions of events per second from companies all over the globe. The platforms are optimized for durability, high availability, low latency, internet-scale footprint and operability. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships that it builds, the creativity it brings to the table, and the collaboration of being together. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our employees can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Build fault-tolerant, horizontally scalable solutions running in multi-tenant environments Write in Go, Java Rust or C++, amongst other languages Use Kafka, Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch and other open-source components Own meaningful parts of our service, have an impact, grow with the company Who You Are: You have a BS/MS/PhD in a scientific field or equivalent experience You have significant backend programming experience in one or more languages (Go, Java, Rust, C++) You have been exposed to working on problems (high durability / low latency /…) You can get down to the low-level when needed You care about simple designs and performance You want to work in a fast, high-growth startup environment that respects its engineers and customers Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our Internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $130,000 - $300,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The People Service Center will help to design the experience shaping the future of Datadog Employee Experience with a focus on our Users’ experience. You will manage innovative thinking, business process and systems initiatives that will ultimately improve the candidate, employee and People team experience. A Team Lead performs diverse roles as project leaders, process optimizers, change managers, advisors, and connectors. As a consultant and strategist you use HR domain fluency, agility, and excellent project management skills to advise leaders, guide projects, and ultimately design superior solutions which will ensure operational readiness for scale across our global organization. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Manage, lead, and coach a team that will deliver best-in-class experiences that leverages optimal workflows, automation, and process streamlining capabilities to operate more efficiently. Enable the People team to succeed by driving discovery, planning, and developing process and systems solutions across our People Infrastructure; creating SLA’s to drive efficiency and accountability Work with the business to build networks, experiences, and pre/post onboarding material and surveys Champion collaborative cross functional relationships with Recruiting, IT, Workplace Services, Payroll, and hiring managers to ensure a successful hiring process and engaging onboarding experience for new hires. Develop initiatives, policies and programs to complement existing practices and create consistency across the organization, in alignment with Datadog brand and messaging Partner closely with stakeholder teams to advise on how to successfully operationalize People initiatives within the existing system and process ecosystem. Seek out creative solutions to provide guidance, troubleshoot and resolve issues, escalating when appropriate Create and present content related to projects, facilitate working sessions, lead and contribute to project review. Develop comprehensive project plans, workflow, and guidelines for assigned projects Leverage data and storytelling to support decision-making, escalate risks, and monitor adoption of People initiatives Who You Are: 5+ years of professional experience working in People Operations or a related field Highly organized with attention to detail and the ability to prioritize and work well in an environment with competing demands Experienced in building, scaling and leading large scale or cross-functional initiatives and programs (such as onboarding or training programs) Passionate about coaching others with 1+ years of direct management experience Skilled at operating with a sense of urgency Able to successfully navigate an ever-changing process Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Team Lead, Expert Services Architecture We are Datadog's in-house deployment experts. The Expert Services team enables new and existing customers to successfully deploy all aspects of Datadog using a guided, timeboxed, pair-programming methodology that is unique in the industry. Every Expert Services Architect (ESA) is focused on delivering pre-defined, specifically scoped engagements to our customers in order to help our customers become Datadog experts and drive adoption internally. We do this by utilizing screen share technologies to perform “guided hands-on-keyboard” operations with our customers. You will lead and coach a talented team of individual contributors as they work with multiple customers and a myriad of technologies. You will lead a team of individual contributors and be immersed in a fast-paced environment where you will be challenged, but will also immediately witness your contributions to Datadog and to our customers. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Manage, develop, and mentor a fast-paced team of ESAs. Identify needs for internal and external processes and services, and is proactive in proposing solutions, designing and implementing them. Lead recruiting efforts to find and hire top talent within your region. Ensure successful onboarding, development and education of new and existing ESAs. Streamline communication and feedback directly with our Datadog customers from a leadership level. Report on the capacity planning and scheduling of individual contributors. Develop and ever-board the training and certification process for regional partners aligned with the Expert Services offerings Train and enable sales representatives in your region to understand how to position and sell Expert Services. Act as an escalation point for customers and ESAs to provide guidance, technical assistance and issue resolution when needed. Lead weekly, monthly and quarterly meetings with your team. Work closely with the greater Technical Solutions leadership and other groups throughout the organization (Sales, Customer Success, Engineering, Product) to tackle urgent matters and to implement process improvements. Who You Are: Passionate about people management, building culture and growing careers Experienced in 2-3 years in leadership in a Presales, Post Sales, Consultancy or adjacent customer facing role with a successful track record Self-motivated, detail-attentive and have a desire for continuous learning A critical thinker who leads with a client-centric consultative approach Experienced in successful creation and implementation of process and procedure in a rapidly scaling company Comfortable in high pressure situations Understand concepts around current infrastructure trends and monitoring solutions and technologies Previous experience working in a and/or fast-paced organization Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive global and US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. As a Technical Curriculum Developer on the Engineering Enablement team, you will help build programs that enable engineering employees with the skills, mindsets, practices and sense of community needed to build and deliver best-in-class software. Our team strives to build robust, scalable, and standardized programs focused on product and technology knowledge where everyone, regardless of their team or location, has an equitable experience and relevant enablement paths. We are building a robust onboarding program for our engineers. You’ll work with internal subject matter experts to create hands-on experiences that introduce Datadog engineers to how we develop software, our tooling and various repositories. Beyond that you’ll also support the development of ongoing enablement programs focused on introducing new software, processes, tooling, etc. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Develop our internal facing technical education efforts built for Datadog’s engineering in collaboration with enablement program managers and internal subject matter experts. Partner with our engineering and product teams to produce engaging enablement materials including code labs, live and recorded presentations, documentation, presentation, facilitator guides and other content used by Datadog's engineers Evaluate engineering training requirements, and turn those requirements into a roadmap with clearly scoped courses that have well defined learning paths Document our processes so that other teams can leverage our tools and offerings Help create and maintain our technical systems, tools, and environments used in our various enablement programs Who You Are: An experienced curriculum developer with 3-5 years experience building courses for technical audiences (e.g. engineers, developers etc) Able to transform technical topics into engaging, informative, and interesting educational materials Someone who enjoys self-driven exploration and education in new technologies, and ideally familiar with at least two programming languages You have previous experience as an SRE, developer, or other technical role You have real-world experience with containers or orchestrated environments (such as Kubernetes) or IaaS providers (AWS, GCP, etc) You have deep experience with monitoring tools and observability You have experience building tracks in Instruqt You have created or actively maintained a certification program Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups) Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+ Competitive global benefits Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. The reasonably estimated salary for this role at Datadog ranges from $117,000 - $142,000, plus a competitive equity package, and may include variable compensation. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. Reporting directly to the CFO, this is an opportunity to lead the design and build-out of the FP&A function, and make a significant impact at a best-in-class SaaS technology company. As Datadog’s Vice President of FP&A, you will provide financial leadership to drive results and ensure operational efficiency across the organization. Working closely with the senior leadership team, you’ll partner to enhance and better integrate Finance with other functions in the business. This will include the development, presentation, and maintenance of the company’s long-range financial model and financial management reporting. Your team will manage operating budgets, lead the preparation of materials and presentations for various audiences including the Board of Directors, and guide projects from the conceptual stages through the review process and implementation. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Lead and build a best-in-class FP&A team that can strategically think through setting up our financial processes and tools for the future, as well as create proactive working partnerships with budget owners to ensure smooth financial operations Create and implement an integrated business planning process, including long-term strategic planning, forecasting and annual budgeting Create weekly and monthly reporting to clearly identify variances to forecast, budget, and historical expenses, provided in a clear and action-oriented format to drive decisions Partner with business teams to create dashboards, tools, and insights that align to each team’s specific needs and financial outcomes Tie the company’s objectives to a clear set of metrics that we can use to track our progress; understand business drivers, create the metrics to understand them, and report on them in a high impact way Address ad hoc financial requests when they come up to help the business tackle the complex financial questions Who You Are: Skilled in financial analysis, detail-oriented, and proficient in building and using complicated data sources, financial modeling, and multi-year projections A proven leader with the ability to effectively manage and develop an FP&A team An excellent communicator and presenter with an ability to influence all levels, including senior-level executives, with strong interpersonal skills. Additionally, an excellent problem-solver, especially within a highly innovative environment A leader with a track record of success in delivering high-quality work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment Bachelor’s degree required and MBA a plus A finance expert with at least 10-15 years of experience in FP&A (or similar level of experience) Experience with Salesforce, Adaptive and NetSuite is a plus Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply. Benefits and Growth: Generous and competitive global and US benefits New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan Continuous career development and pathing opportunities Product training to develop an in-depth understanding of our product and space Best in breed onboarding Internal mentor and buddy program cross-departmentally Friendly and inclusive workplace culture Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog. Actual compensation is based on factors such as the candidate's skills, qualifications, and experience. In addition, Datadog offers a wide range of best in class, comprehensive and inclusive employee benefits for this role including healthcare, dental, parental planning, and mental health benefits, a 401(k) plan and match, paid time off, fitness reimbursements, and a discounted employee stock purchase plan. The WebOps Team builds and maintains the public Datadog websites. We use Hugo/11ty, AWS, GCP, Gitlab, Terraform, Serverless, and of course Datadog itself. As a Frontend Developer on the team, you will produce pixel-perfect digital assets, ensuring they are always fast, correct, available, and represent the voice of Datadog. You will assist in launching and expanding static sites, developing design system components, building out new features with our Brand Design team, and improving our Frontend codebase. This is a creative role where your work will have huge exposure and impact – we receive tens of thousands of views in a day. At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them. What You’ll Do: Frontend development using Hugo/11ty static site generators, Webpack/ESBuild, SCSS, Vanilla JS, Bootstrap/TailwindCSS Build new areas of our corporate sites: new pages, templates, and UI elements using modern frameworks, tooling, and tests Optimize the performance of Datadog’s public-facing web sites Audit and improve site hygiene for SEO and user experience Experiment with and optimize on-page elements and site navigation Who You Are: You can build responsive, modern web pages with HTML, Sass, and Javascript ES6+ and / or Node You have approximately 2-4 years+ of web development, working on a large, public website You are fanatical about details: code style, exact rendering, performance, and good design You have experience working with or implementing design systems You have experience with Hugo, 11ty, or other static site generator Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you’re passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.
